 <REPORT _Format="HTML">
 <EMBEDDED_FILE _Type="PricingHTMLFindings" _Version="1.0">

2014-12-20 16:42:49.4300 Content is Complete in DSE:02-01-20 

As of DSE:02-01-20I populate a property called RuleReturnValue with the return result of the rule. I have also added it to the GUI display. This will only be tracked if the other rule level tracking is enabled (i.e. .DSEExecuteRulesLogging.TrackRulesRun is set to "true").

In the case of iterative rules, only the last executed value is recorded and displayed.

2014-12-20 16:42:57.0940 AuthoredAt is 11/14/2008 7:44:44 PM
2014-12-20 16:42:57.0940 Content is Encryption Requirements 

Please do a search for encryption in the Information Security Policy and Standards document. Highlights of the sections include:
E) Handling Requirements
1)
GMAC Secretinformation must beencryptedin storage and transmission, bothinternally within the GMAC network, as well as externally
2)
GMAC Confidentialdata must be encrypted in storage and transmissionexternally. Encryption is discretionary within GMAC internally (depends on
sensitivity)
3) The following types of
Personal Informationmust be encrypted in transmissionand storage. First name or initial and last name in combination with one of the
following:
a) A social security number or other government-issued identifier such as a
tax identification number or drivers license number
b) Financial account information (account number, credit or debit card
numbers or banking information)
c) Date of birth
d) Mothers maiden name
e) Medical information (including electronic Protected Heath information
(ePHI)) as defined by regulations
f) Digitized or electronic signature
GMAC Information Security Policy & Standards
 2007 GMAC, LLC.
Corporate Policy ManualPublished: 22-May-2007All rights reserved. Page 38 of 66
Printed copies of this document are considered uncontrolled and unofficial
Encryption of these types of Personal Information is not required if transmitted on
the internal Local Area Network (LAN) within a GMAC
Enterprise-Class DataCenter
or stored on servers within the highest Tier of GMAC enterprise-class datacenters as defined in the GMAC security baseline on Data Centers. In addition,
the enterprise-class data centers need to have compensating controls in place to
limit access to data files containing Personal Information. Encryption is required for
transmitting these types of Personal Information across a network that is external
to the GMAC enterprise-class data center.
4) In handling GMAC Information pertaining to GMAC personnel matters, GMAC
managers must adhere to any additional controls that have been established to
comply with local laws protecting employees. These directives are outlined in
policies managed by GMAC Human Resources.
5) The processing and handling of Personal Information and Sensitive Data may be
governed by general or specific data privacy statements or laws. To determine
whether particular information constitutes Personal Information or Sensitive Data in
any jurisdiction, and applicable restrictions on processing and handling of such
information, including restrictions on the transmission across national borders
contact the Global Privacy Center at GMAC Headquarters or the Legal Staff. For
more information, visit the GMAC Global Privacy Home Page.
6) For
Export-Controlledinformation, although export control laws vary by country,they generally restrict the export of technical data and technology related to
military/defense articles and information that has both commercial and military
uses (referred to as dual-use).
7) The Export-Controlled designation does not include information that has an
export classification of EAR99. However, if the proposed export of EAR99
information is to an embargoed country, to an end-user of concern or in support of
a prohibited end-use, you may be required to obtain an export authorization before
proceeding with the export. Information deemed to be "Export-Controlled" cannot
be exported or shared without the proper export authorization.
Decisions to use GMAC SECRET and GMAC CONFIDENTIAL categories and associated
controls to protect GMAC Information other than Personal Information or Export Controlled,
which could result in adverse consequences such as the above, are at the discretion of the
GMAC Business Unit based on the severity of the impact of unauthorized disclosure.


Cryptographic Controls
A) At a minimum, encryption must adhere to the following requirements:
1) Where encryption is implemented, GMAC-approved methods mu

Also attached these to the story in a spreadsheet.
QuestionsAnswersCARS has been updated will be known by which property in Pega. Has thisbeen built as a part of GIF- CARS interface, if so to which property mapsDont know of any property but question should be raised to the GIF team to check their data dictionary.I did find a response property that looks promising but I don't have a definition for it.(GMAC-SAM-Integration-GIFSoap-AI2-RESPONSE_DATA.LAST_REVISION_DATE property)At what time intervals should we allow a call to be made to CARSAs needed when an SR or Account is opened.How frequently do we think that the same SR will be opened in the lifecycle of a SR?Probably <10 times for these SR types but this seems to be a capacity/performance related question.Let's leave performance until we discover an issue in performance testing.What points in the system does a SR get opened? Interaction history, SR open from worklist, find work,Open SR from a worklist, Open an SR from Interaction History, Open an Account from Account Search,If someone changes the data in CARS, when does that get reflected, is it real time or a nightly batch.Realtime at the time of SR being opened or upon click of the Refresh button.If it is not real time,can we just provide a manual refresh CARS buttonnot applicable due to realtime requirement

2014-12-20 16:42:59.9490 AuthoredAt is 1/21/2009 1:37:40 AM
2014-12-20 16:42:59.9490 Content is 01_20_2009 Q and A for ChargeOff$$ - Canned Report 

Answers also posted as an attachment to the story.
QuestionsAnswers1. Input criteria will be read only on the second page or do they want to modify the input date range on the fly (On the second page where reports are rendered)Whatever is easiest to provide quickly.We will demo the report to the business and ask them if what is provided is acceptable and if not we will modify as needed.2. Sum by year will represent only $ amount because date, a/c , charge off type,etc does not seem relevant when you are grouping by year, quarter month, week and even day.In addition to $ they would like "Count" of SRs in the grouping3. Do we want a drill down? If yes, do we want the drill down segregated by quarter, month, week, day or all at onceWe want drill down by summary level selected.So if they select Month then only summary bars for Apr, May, Jun, Jul, etc.If they select Day then summary bars for 04/01/08, 04/02/08, 04/03/08, etc.2008 + 2ndQuarter + Apr +1stweek + Monday - SC 001 -SC 002Or2008-SC001-SC0024. If my dates range (input parameter) is 04/01/08- 09/09/09. Is sum by year 04/01/08- 12/31/08 or 1/1/08-12/31/08 or 04/01/08- 04-03-09? Same question for month, week, quarter, etc?I believe in this scenario, Sum by year is 04/01/08-12/31/08 in one summary and 1/1/09-09/09/09 in the second summary.5. We will need to check the performance requirements based on the data that is stored/available in the database.Performance should be checked by the Performance Tester outside of the story.Do not worry about performance at this time.6. Should you be able to open a SR in read only mode after drill down? Or is It only for information and one will not be able to open the SR.For now, lets do whatever comes out of the box and/or is easist.Most important to provide a

2014-12-20 16:43:03.3320 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:43:03.4940 AuthoredAt is 1/27/2009 4:29:46 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:03.4950 Content is Answers to 1/27/2009 am email of questions 

1. The rest of that answer was: Most important to provide a working demo of the report without the ability to drill down into the SR.

2. In the end, we will need the ability to open from the SR line of the report through some mechanism. Options for the mechanism is what needs to be determined by the technical team.
Examples of options may be:
Double click on the SR,
Single click on the SR and get a popup window allowing the user to open the SR,
Single click on the SR and receive a Glimpse view that allows the user to open the SR.

3. No validation is needed. If they select a time period that is smaller than the summary period, the summary period should summarize appropriately using the data received from the date range. E.g. Jan 15, 2008 through Jan 15, 2009 with summary set to Year should have 2 summary lines. One for 2008 that contains Jan 15, 2008 through Dec 31, 2008. A second for 2009 that contains Jan 1, 2009 through Jan 15, 2009.

4. No, if they select Sum by Month, and they click the + sign to drill down, they then see the SRs for that month as a list. They do not see Weeks or Days summary levels.
2014-12-20 16:43:03.4950 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:43:03.6780 AuthoredAt is 1/27/2009 5:06:42 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:03.6780 Content is Date/Time Stamp Clarification 

Latest Date/Time Stamp will be displayed when we click the refresh button in the UI. This date will signify the time when was the last time data was fetched from CARS. This is just for display on UI screen.

Reply from Jeff::
I think that this sounds fine as long as the date/time is only updated after the refresh is complete. That way, if the refresh fails for some reason, we dont mislead the user by showing the date/time the button was clicked instead of the date/time of the update.

2014-12-20 16:43:21.1220 AuthoredAt is 2/3/2009 7:41:44 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:21.1230 Content is Option C Question to the Business 

Pega's structure supports a certain model where an Operator belongs to one Unit and a Unit belongs to one Division and a Division belongs to one Organization. At the Division Level is where we call out Semperian versus Canada.
One option would be to create another Division that is Both Semp and Canada with it's own set of units.
Another option would be to have a these "Both" users have a U.S. and Canadian operator ID
A third option would be to hack something into Pega that is non standard to support the concept.

2014-12-20 16:43:27.9550 AuthoredAt is 2/4/2009 8:52:52 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:27.9560 Content is Charge off category- how is that determined?  ANSWER 

Hi,
We have an output attribute called "charge off category" which as we understand is determined by collectible and uncollectible amount? what will be the charge off category of a work item which has both collectible and uncollectible amount not equal to 0.
Regards,
Akshat
-------------------------------------------
Answer:
No, the charge off type does not depend on the collectible/uncollectible amount. The charge off type is selected, then the amounts are filled in.
If you are referring to the FDD, are you aware of the warranty work that has been done? Some of the charge off types have changed. Here is a list of what is in COD now:
Misuse
Misrepresentation
Total theft with insurance proceeds
Total collision with insurance proceeds
Total theft without insurance proceeds
Total collision without insurance proceeds
Skip
Conversion of title
Abandonment
Low Balance
2014-12-20 16:43:27.9560 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:43:28.1230 AuthoredAt is 2/4/2009 8:53:55 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:28.1230 Content is definition of charge off category and charge off type  ANSWER 

From our discussion on 29-Jan,
We understand that
Charge off type contains information like Total theft-insurance proceeds ,Total collission - insurance proceedsextra..
Charge off category should be total loss, special coll and hrc-comtrac and hrc-non comtrac..
Pls correct us if some mapping is incorrect here.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Answer:
Charge Off Types:
Misuse
Misrepresentation
Total theft with insurance proceeds
Total collision with insurance proceeds
Total theft without insurance proceeds
Total collision without insurance proceeds
Skip
Conversion of title
Abandonment
Low Balance

Charge off categories:
High Risk Collections
Special Collections
Total Loss
It is not anticipated that the High Risk ComTRAC will be utilized, therefore it is not listed.
2014-12-20 16:43:28.1310 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:43:28.2970 AuthoredAt is 2/4/2009 8:54:45 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:28.3110 Content is Mapping of Charge off Generation date and charge off category  ANSWER 

Hey Jeff,
Just wanted to know what should we map the Charge off generation date to? Is it the date of which a SR(a CO work item) was created? or the date/time at which it was closed/resolved/processed(by Padma)?
Also, what does charge off category map to in the COD DB table? We are not seeing any charge off category like HRC-Comtrac and HRC-Non Comtrac? We just have Total loss charge off , Special collection,High risk collections. That's only the 3 possible values, correct?
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Answer:

The Charge off date is the date it was closed/resolved/processed by Padma.
The Charge off categories are:
High Risk Collections
Special Collections
Total Loss
It is not anticipated that the High Risk ComTRAC will be utilized, therefore it is not listed.

2014-12-20 16:43:31.2060 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:31.3720 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:08:48 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:31.3720 Content is 01_20_2009 Q and A for ChargeOff$$ - Canned Report 

Answers also posted as an attachment to the story.
QuestionsAnswers1. Input criteria will be read only on the second page or do they want to modify the input date range on the fly (On the second page where reports are rendered)Whatever is easiest to provide quickly.We will demo the report to the business and ask them if what is provided is acceptable and if not we will modify as needed.2. Sum by year will represent only $ amount because date, a/c , charge off type,etc does not seem relevant when you are grouping by year, quarter month, week and even day.In addition to $ they would like "Count" of SRs in the grouping3. Do we want a drill down? If yes, do we want the drill down segregated by quarter, month, week, day or all at onceWe want drill down by summary level selected.So if they select Month then only summary bars for Apr, May, Jun, Jul, etc.If they select Day then summary bars for 04/01/08, 04/02/08, 04/03/08, etc.2008 + 2ndQuarter + Apr +1stweek + Monday - SC 001 -SC 002Or2008-SC001-SC0024. If my dates range (input parameter) is 04/01/08- 09/09/09. Is sum by year 04/01/08- 12/31/08 or 1/1/08-12/31/08 or 04/01/08- 04-03-09? Same question for month, week, quarter, etc?I believe in this scenario, Sum by year is 04/01/08-12/31/08 in one summary and 1/1/09-09/09/09 in the second summary.5. We will need to check the performance requirements based on the data that is stored/available in the database.Performance should be checked by the Performance Tester outside of the story.Do not worry about performance at this time.6. Should you be able to open a SR in read only mode after drill down? Or is It only for information and one will not be able to open the SR.For now, lets do whatever comes out of the box and/or is easist.Most important to provide a
2014-12-20 16:43:31.3720 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:31.5410 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:08:48 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:31.5410 Content is Additional questions from Offshore- 22-Jan-09 

1)Is the validation forsum by years/ Sum by quarteris needed if the date range selected is less than a year / quarter?
2) What does Chareoffcompletiondate map to,in COD? There are 3 types of date in the COD system:
a) Date of loss
b) Charge off Effective date
c) Charge off approve date
Similarly, there are two amounts, collectible and uncollectible amount. Which one maps to Charge off amount?
3) If the user selects "Sum by month" and clicks on the "+" sign that indicates drill down, does he then see "Sum by week"? or do they see all the SRs with the required details that were charged off in that month?
4) In question no.6 in the notes entered , there is an incomplete answer/statement. Can you please update that?
Also for the same question no.6, as i understand correctly, Wipro will need to get back and communicate whether a SR can be opened or not, correct?

What date field shouldbe mapped to Chargeoffconpletiondate? The business believes the correct date to use is the "Date of Loss".Could you confirm in the R1 code that the"Date of Loss" is the date that Padma resolves the charge off?

What field should be mapped to Charge Off Amount? I talked to the business about this and they said for this report there should be 3 Charge off Amount columns on the report. They are:1.) Uncollectible Amount 2.) Collectible Amount3.) Uncollectible/Collectible Total Amount

Per the call this morning 1/23/2009, proceed with using the Summary View instead of using the List View. This should enable Summing and Group By.
Also, proceed to use the Single button on a Summary List to popup a set of buttons to support Email, Print, Export features.

2014-12-20 16:43:34.5920 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:34.8000 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:08:48 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:34.8000 Content is Answers to 1/27/2009 am email of questions 

1. The rest of that answer was: Most important to provide a working demo of the report without the ability to drill down into the SR.

2. In the end, we will need the ability to open from the SR line of the report through some mechanism. Options for the mechanism is what needs to be determined by the technical team.
Examples of options may be:
Double click on the SR,
Single click on the SR and get a popup window allowing the user to open the SR,
Single click on the SR and receive a Glimpse view that allows the user to open the SR.

3. No validation is needed. If they select a time period that is smaller than the summary period, the summary period should summarize appropriately using the data received from the date range. E.g. Jan 15, 2008 through Jan 15, 2009 with summary set to Year should have 2 summary lines. One for 2008 that contains Jan 15, 2008 through Dec 31, 2008. A second for 2009 that contains Jan 1, 2009 through Jan 15, 2009.

4. No, if they select Sum by Month, and they click the + sign to drill down, they then see the SRs for that month as a list. They do not see Weeks or Days summary levels.
2014-12-20 16:43:34.8150 Author is Member:15855

2014-12-20 16:43:37.9740 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:38.1230 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:08:48 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:38.1350 Content is Charge off category- how is that determined?  ANSWER 

Hi,
We have an output attribute called "charge off category" which as we understand is determined by collectible and uncollectible amount? what will be the charge off category of a work item which has both collectible and uncollectible amount not equal to 0.
Regards,
Akshat
-------------------------------------------
Answer:
No, the charge off type does not depend on the collectible/uncollectible amount. The charge off type is selected, then the amounts are filled in.
If you are referring to the FDD, are you aware of the warranty work that has been done? Some of the charge off types have changed. Here is a list of what is in COD now:
Misuse
Misrepresentation
Total theft with insurance proceeds
Total collision with insurance proceeds
Total theft without insurance proceeds
Total collision without insurance proceeds
Skip
Conversion of title
Abandonment
Low Balance
2014-12-20 16:43:38.1470 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:38.3120 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:08:48 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:38.3240 Content is definition of charge off category and charge off type  ANSWER 

From our discussion on 29-Jan,
We understand that
Charge off type contains information like Total theft-insurance proceeds ,Total collission - insurance proceedsextra..
Charge off category should be total loss, special coll and hrc-comtrac and hrc-non comtrac..
Pls correct us if some mapping is incorrect here.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Answer:
Charge Off Types:
Misuse
Misrepresentation
Total theft with insurance proceeds
Total collision with insurance proceeds
Total theft without insurance proceeds
Total collision without insurance proceeds
Skip
Conversion of title
Abandonment
Low Balance

Charge off categories:
High Risk Collections
Special Collections
Total Loss
It is not anticipated that the High Risk ComTRAC will be utilized, therefore it is not listed.
2014-12-20 16:43:38.3350 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:38.5000 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:08:48 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:38.5030 Content is Mapping of Charge off Generation date and charge off category  ANSWER 

Hey Jeff,
Just wanted to know what should we map the Charge off generation date to? Is it the date of which a SR(a CO work item) was created? or the date/time at which it was closed/resolved/processed(by Padma)?
Also, what does charge off category map to in the COD DB table? We are not seeing any charge off category like HRC-Comtrac and HRC-Non Comtrac? We just have Total loss charge off , Special collection,High risk collections. That's only the 3 possible values, correct?
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Answer:

The Charge off date is the date it was closed/resolved/processed by Padma.
The Charge off categories are:
High Risk Collections
Special Collections
Total Loss
It is not anticipated that the High Risk ComTRAC will be utilized, therefore it is not listed.
2014-12-20 16:43:38.5030 Author is Member:15855

Sum by year will represent only $ amount because date, a/c , charge off type,etc does not seem relevant when you are grouping by year, quarter month, week and even day.In addition to $ they would like "Count" of SRs in the grouping3. If yes, do we want the drill down segregated by quarter, month, week, day or all at onceWe want drill down by summary level selected.So if they select Month then only summary bars for Apr, May, Jun, Jul, etc.If they select Day then summary bars for 04/01/08, 04/02/08, 04/03/08, etc.2008 + 2ndQuarter + Apr +1stweek + Monday - SC 001 -SC 002Or2008-SC001-SC0024. If my dates range (input parameter) is 04/01/08- 09/09/09. Is sum by year 04/01/08- 12/31/08 or 1/1/08-12/31/08 or 04/01/08- 04-03-09? Same question for month, week, quarter, etc?I believe in this scenario, Sum by year is 04/01/08-12/31/08 in one summary and 1/1/09-09/09/09 in the second summary.5. 2014-12-20 16:43:52.1540 Content is Answers to 1/27/2009 am email of questions 

1. The rest of that answer was: Most important to provide a working demo of the report without the ability to drill down into the SR.

2. In the end, we will need the ability to open from the SR line of the report through some mechanism. Options for the mechanism is what needs to be determined by the technical team.
Examples of options may be:
Double click on the SR,
Single click on the SR and get a popup window allowing the user to open the SR,
Single click on the SR and receive a Glimpse view that allows the user to open the SR.

3. No validation is needed. If they select a time period that is smaller than the summary period, the summary period should summarize appropriately using the data received from the date range. E.g. Jan 15, 2008 through Jan 15, 2009 with summary set to Year should have 2 summary lines. One for 2008 that contains Jan 15, 2008 through Dec 31, 2008. A second for 2009 that contains Jan 1, 2009 through Jan 15, 2009.

4. No, if they select Sum by Month, and they click the + sign to drill down, they then see the SRs for that month as a list. They do not see Weeks or Days summary levels.

2014-12-20 16:43:55.8130 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:57.9030 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:15:10 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:57.9030 Content is Charge off category- how is that determined?  ANSWER 

Hi,
We have an output attribute called "charge off category" which as we understand is determined by collectible and uncollectible amount? what will be the charge off category of a work item which has both collectible and uncollectible amount not equal to 0.
Regards,
Akshat
-------------------------------------------
Answer:
No, the charge off type does not depend on the collectible/uncollectible amount. The charge off type is selected, then the amounts are filled in.
If you are referring to the FDD, are you aware of the warranty work that has been done? Some of the charge off types have changed. Here is a list of what is in COD now:
Misuse
Misrepresentation
Total theft with insurance proceeds
Total collision with insurance proceeds
Total theft without insurance proceeds
Total collision without insurance proceeds
Skip
Conversion of title
Abandonment
Low Balance
2014-12-20 16:43:58.1330 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:58.5510 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:15:10 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:58.6480 Content is definition of charge off category and charge off type  ANSWER 

From our discussion on 29-Jan,
We understand that
Charge off type contains information like Total theft-insurance proceeds ,Total collission - insurance proceedsextra..
Charge off category should be total loss, special coll and hrc-comtrac and hrc-non comtrac..
Pls correct us if some mapping is incorrect here.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Answer:
Charge Off Types:
Misuse
Misrepresentation
Total theft with insurance proceeds
Total collision with insurance proceeds
Total theft without insurance proceeds
Total collision without insurance proceeds
Skip
Conversion of title
Abandonment
Low Balance

Charge off categories:
High Risk Collections
Special Collections
Total Loss
It is not anticipated that the High Risk ComTRAC will be utilized, therefore it is not listed.
2014-12-20 16:43:58.6710 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:43:59.0120 AuthoredAt is 2/5/2009 2:15:10 PM
2014-12-20 16:43:59.0120 Content is Mapping of Charge off Generation date and charge off category  ANSWER 

Hey Jeff,
Just wanted to know what should we map the Charge off generation date to? Is it the date of which a SR(a CO work item) was created? or the date/time at which it was closed/resolved/processed(by Padma)?
Also, what does charge off category map to in the COD DB table? We are not seeing any charge off category like HRC-Comtrac and HRC-Non Comtrac? We just have Total loss charge off , Special collection,High risk collections. That's only the 3 possible values, correct?
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Answer:

The Charge off date is the date it was closed/resolved/processed by Padma.
The Charge off categories are:
High Risk Collections
Special Collections
Total Loss
It is not anticipated that the High Risk ComTRAC will be utilized, therefore it is not listed.

2014-12-20 16:44:02.4010 Content is Clarifications raised on 9-Feb 

Hi Jeff/Duane/Brad,

Please clarify for the following

Assumptions::

We are not doing skill based rebalancing
We are not deleting the operators. We are just making them available/unavailable
When we are going to availability/unavailability of the agents the preamble is that they are already present in the site

Issues to be Addressed
What are we going to do with those work items with statuses fulfilled, resolved, cancelled or open phone calls? But as per our discussion Duane/Brad suggested that they are going to stay in the worklist only. But still it has to be confirmed by the business
the story also should be changed to remove the condition of adding /deleting. It should be only making available/Unavailable
All the workitems for all operators (belonging to a work group) have to be transferred to the workbasket.
Rebalancing on available/unavailable operators is based on user input. He can select one or more or all to do the rebalancing. Duane/Brad/Jeff to confirm.

In VersionOne Rebalance story should be split in to two parts and the changes needs to be incorporated as discussed in the call.
2014-12-20 16:44:02.4010 Author is Member:15418

BET - Responded to all questions except for[***TBD***]. This needs further input from the business/Jeff.
Please clarify for the following

Assumptions::

We are not doing skill based rebalancing
[BET - We will be doing skills based rebalancing. For the first showing of this functionality, we will only focus on a work group. But to complete the story, we will have to implement rebalance based on a skill (or set of skills)]
We are not deleting the operators. We are just making them available/unavailable [BET - correct].
When we are going to availability/unavailability of the agents the preamble is that they are already present in the site [BET - yes, the operators records will already exist in the system]

Issues to be Addressed
What are we going to do with those work items with statuses fulfilled, resolved, cancelled or open phone calls? But as per our discussion Duane/Brad suggested that they are going to stay in the worklist only. But still it has to be confirmed by the business [***TBD***]
the story also should be changed to remove the condition of adding /deleting. It should be only making available/Unavailable [BET - I will make this correction in the story]
All the workitems for all operators (belonging to a work group) have to be transferred to the workbasket. [BET - Yes, for allitems selected in arebalance step, they willbe transferred to the workgroup's workbasket such that theworkbasket routing process can redistribute the work].
Rebalancing on available/unavailable operators is based on user input. He can select one or more or all to do the rebalancing. Duane/Brad/Jeff to confirm. [BET - Yes, rebalancing is based on which workgroup gets selected to provide a list of operators. A select all button provides the quick selection of all operators to rebalance on. Otherwise, the user can select each operator one by one to include them in the rebalance.]

In VersionOne Rebalance story should be split in to two parts and the changes needs to be incorporated as discussed in the call. [BET - I added a new story to accomodate this. we will need to move those tasks/test that pertain to the availability process.]

2014-12-20 16:44:02.9590 AuthoredAt is 2/9/2009 11:23:26 PM
2014-12-20 16:44:02.9880 Content is Further clarification on work statuses 

Story says:
The system will route all work items with the exception of those with the status of fulfilled, resolved, cancelled or open phone calls
Work object statuses:
28.01.0Appendix  8  Service Request Status ValuesThis section identifies the various values for Statuses and associated rules.
28.11.1Status  Valid ValuesFollowing are the valid values for Status Codes:
Ref
Status Codes
Description
1
New
New transaction that has not been assigned yet
2
Active
Transaction has been assigned and opened by individual
3
Cancelled
Transaction was cancelled prior to completion by customer request or other
4
Pending Follow-up Required
Transaction has been completed from GMAC perspective and is awaiting response/information from customer. Follow up is required.
5
Pending No Follow-up Required
Transaction has been completed from GMAC perspective and is awaiting response/information from customer. No follow up required. Business rules define time period after no response from customer when status is changed to Cancelled
6
Fulfilled
Transaction is successfully completed
7
Rejected
Any Service Request that was rejected

2014-12-20 16:44:19.2580 AuthoredAt is 2/10/2009 6:49:27 PM
2014-12-20 16:44:19.2580 Content is Further clarification on work statuses 

Story says:
The system will route all work items with the exception of those with the status of fulfilled, resolved, cancelled or open phone calls
Work object statuses:
28.01.0Appendix  8  Service Request Status ValuesThis section identifies the various values for Statuses and associated rules.
28.11.1Status  Valid ValuesFollowing are the valid values for Status Codes:
Ref
Status Codes
Description
1
New
New transaction that has not been assigned yet
2
Active
Transaction has been assigned and opened by individual
3
Cancelled
Transaction was cancelled prior to completion by customer request or other
4
Pending Follow-up Required
Transaction has been completed from GMAC perspective and is awaiting response/information from customer. Follow up is required.
5
Pending No Follow-up Required
Transaction has been completed from GMAC perspective and is awaiting response/information from customer. No follow up required. Business rules define time period after no response from customer when status is changed to Cancelled
6
Fulfilled
Transaction is successfully completed
7
Rejected
Any Service Request that was rejected

BET - Responded to all questions except for[***TBD***]. This needs further input from the business/Jeff.
Please clarify for the following

Assumptions::

We are not doing skill based rebalancing
[BET - We will be doing skills based rebalancing. For the first showing of this functionality, we will only focus on a work group. But to complete the story, we will have to implement rebalance based on a skill (or set of skills)]
We are not deleting the operators. We are just making them available/unavailable [BET - correct].
When we are going to availability/unavailability of the agents the preamble is that they are already present in the site [BET - yes, the operators records will already exist in the system]

Issues to be Addressed
What are we going to do with those work items with statuses fulfilled, resolved, cancelled or open phone calls? But as per our discussion Duane/Brad suggested that they are going to stay in the worklist only. But still it has to be confirmed by the business [***TBD***]
the story also should be changed to remove the condition of adding /deleting. It should be only making available/Unavailable [BET - I will make this correction in the story]
All the workitems for all operators (belonging to a work group) have to be transferred to the workbasket. [BET - Yes, for allitems selected in arebalance step, they willbe transferred to the workgroup's workbasket such that theworkbasket routing process can redistribute the work].
Rebalancing on available/unavailable operators is based on user input. He can select one or more or all to do the rebalancing. Duane/Brad/Jeff to confirm. [BET - Yes, rebalancing is based on which workgroup gets selected to provide a list of operators. A select all button provides the quick selection of all operators to rebalance on. Otherwise, the user can select each operator one by one to include them in the rebalance.]

In VersionOne Rebalance story should be split in to two parts and the changes needs to be incorporated as discussed in the call. [BET - I added a new story to accomodate this. we will need to move those tasks/test that pertain to the availability process.]

2014-12-20 16:44:25.2080 AuthoredAt is 2/13/2009 11:12:00 AM
2014-12-20 16:44:25.2080 Content is Adding notes/answers for questions asked on the Hybrid approach 

What extra fields do we need to addin the initiator screen? Do we assume that"reason of entry" is same as "comments" and we can entirely copy the "comments" sections in the "reason for entry field"There are no new fields required on the Initiator's screen. For now, we will assume that the "Reason for Charge Off" is placed in the Comments field.

b) We need to capture preparer's name in the back ground. If a manager delegate the Follow up work to someone other than the original initiator and if the SR then comes to the manager for review(after follow up has been completed), do we update the preparer's name? Where is this information displayed for Mel?
At this point, the only place that Mel can see who all has worked on this SR is on the History screen. From there he can see who initiated the SR, who else worked on it, and what happened. No need to update the preparer's name.

c) We understand that if uncollectible amount(for a total loss type) isnot equal to 0while initiating , then it will go for managerfor approval else it will go for review as in the existing flow. Please correct us if something has been captured incorrectly.
This is correct.

d) if the support doc check box is not ticked and instead of hiding the "Approve" option in the flow action , can we justthrow an error message when user clicks on "Approve".
We can pop up a message box that informs the user "This Charge Off cannot be approved until the Supporting Document has been approved."

e)There is a statement that says "Padma can reject the work at this point with going through any additional process to update the supporting document".- did it mean "without going through any additional.."
Yes, "without going through any additional.." is what it should have read.

f) If Padma has updated a source document and then she clicks on "Reject", do we need to store the word doc as an attachment with the workitem or do we delete that?
At the point of Rejection, everything that is in place needs to be captured. So if there is an attachment we need to preserve it with the Rejected work object.

g) What other fields does the manager needs to see (in his harness) apart from the amount(existing) and comments(exiting fields). Any fields from the source document needs to come on the manager's screen?
The manager also needs to see the Approve check box and the Reject check box so that he can Approve or Reject the supporting document. If the manager "Rejects" the Supporting Document, he cannot be allowed to Approve the Charge Off. We need to provide the same style of warning as question "d" above but with the text "A rejected Supporting Document cannot support the approval of this Charge Off. Either Approve the Supporting Document or send this Charge Off back for rework."

AJ's comments:Wewent through the R 1 process and realised that there is no "Reject" option for Padma however she has the "Resolve option". So the question would be,if Padmacreates a source document(Source document-Knoxville1.doc) which is attached to the work item and then at the last moment she decides to send it for follow up to either the initiator or someone else in the same work group(existing in R1). Now let's say the initiator amends the work item details as requested and then sends it to the process charge off workbasket (after approve et al..). This time it was picked up by another processor, Padma2. The questions are:
1) Will the initiator who got the request for follow up see that document(Source document-Knoxville1.doc) , how , from where will he access it please?
Answer as on 13-Feb:The initiator will see that document generated by Padma's earlier action as a part of the existing "add or edit attachments" function if he has access to it based on his role (as provided according to R1)
2)will Padma 2 see this document(Source document-Knoxville1.doc)?
Answer on 13-feb-09: Padma2 can see the document generated by Padma1 and as a part of the existing "add or edit attachments" function if she has access to it based on his role (as provided according to R1). However Padma 2 can click on the "Update the source document" and edit the fields and generate a source document that will replace the old one
3)In the Hybrid approach,we have a point no 9)
"If she clicks cancel on this harness, nothing has changed on the SR.If she updates fields and clicks the Generate Supporting Document button, then the process from step 6 is followed with the addition of removing the old document prior to generating the new one."

4) Our question here would be by "adding new while removing the old one", did we mean update the existing source document? When she clicks on "Update source document", we can show the harness with the values populated previously and Padma can edit them and save the document once again. Will that work?

Answer on 13-Feb: We need to update the document with the newly edited/entered information by Padma. There will be only 1 document that Padma1/2/3(any charge off processor) will see. This will be the most updated document/values that were entered by the processor. When Padma clicks on "Update source document", the pega screen will have all the previously entered information in the respective fields. Padma can then edit the fields that she wants to and generate the source document.

5)What are the mandatory fields for the source document, do we need to do any UI level validation to ensure that some important field is not missed?

Answer on 13-Feb: Jeff D will confirm with the business and let us know the set of mandatory fields in the supporting document.<It would also help us to get the corresponding error messages that we need to display when the mandatory fields are not entered>

6) Will the following fields be systematically populated or entered by Padma:

Dealer ? - Entered by Padma
Date Entry processed? - Entered by Padma


7) In which format will the data elements of the source document should be presented on the word document that is generated?

Answer on 13-Feb: Thesame format as the source document sample attached in the story will be used while generating the source document.

Please help us in getting these answers. Please let us know if something is not so clear or if you need more inputs to answer the questions

2014-12-20 16:44:32.0680 AuthoredAt is 2/16/2009 2:59:47 PM
2014-12-20 16:44:32.0680 Content is approach for the modal screen for supporting document 

Jeff/Duane/Brad,
we have a requirement in the story where the supporting document is to be Modal.
"This harness is modal, meaning she cannot do anything to the SR page until this harness is closed."
We did the required R&D to see what does it take to achieve this? We learnt that although we were able to go to the new screenas a pop up, we were not able to save the data that has been entered in the modal screen/new pop up with supporting document information and also do UI level validation on that. This is a result of initial analysis for few hours that we did. Please let us know if you would want us to continue with spending more efforts on doing further R&D or would the team liketo consider the alternative approach suggested below:

a) Padma opens a SR which has an uncollectible charge off amount.
b) Padma clicks on a button/link, "Click Here to Update Supporting Document" and then one section of the screen is automatically displayed(untilt the button is not clicked, it will be hidden)
c) Padma enters the required values and clicks on "Generate Supporting Document" and the document is generated attached to the work object as expected. The supporting document sections hides again and padma see the work item view.
d) Padma decides to update the supporting document , she clicks on button/link, "Click Here to Update Supporting Document" and same section pops up again and then we can repeat through steps b and c.
e) If there are any Mandatory fields that have not been updated, we will throw a UI level error that would ask her to enter the mandatory fields.Once she fills them up as expected and clicks on "Generate Supporting Document", the system works as expected.
It would be great if we could get the direction from ITG/Business to either do more research on the modal screen or begin with work on the alternative approach above, the offshore development team working on this story will be able to make some progress. If not, we will not be a show stopper.

Please let me know if you need more inputs to answer this.
-Akshat

2014-12-20 16:44:33.5730 AuthoredAt is 2/16/2009 9:22:53 PM
2014-12-20 16:44:35.1560 Content is Report Layout and Content Details 


Completion Report will contain 4 sections.

Section 1:
Site (Unit from operatorpxCreateOperator from Rebalance object)
Rebalance Date (pxCreateDateTime from Rebalance objectformatted mm/dd/yyyy)
Reason (new field on Rebalance Object)
Approver (Manager Operator Name from Rebalance Object entered free form)
Processor (pyUpdateOpName)
Section 2:
List of Work reassigned with columns
Account Number (<<page>>.AccountPage.AccountID)
Work Object ID (<<page>>.pyID)
Status (<<page>>.pyStatusWork)
Current Assignee (<<page>>.pxUpdateOpName)
SR Skill (<<page>>.pyDescription)
Sortable by(Status, Current Assignee,Account Number,Service Request Category/Skill)
Section 3:
List of Un-reassigned work with columns
Account Number (<<page>>.AccountPage.AccountID)
Work Object ID (<<page>>.pyID)
Status (<<page>>.pyStatusWork)
Current Assignee (<<page>>.pxUpdateOpName)
SR Skill (<<page>>.pyDescription)

Sortable by(status,Current Assignee,Account Number,Service Request Category/Skill)
Section 4:
Summary Counts by(Work Reassigned,Un-reassigned,Statuses,Service Request Category/skill)

2014-12-20 16:44:35.5200 Content is Display Reasons on Availability or Rebalance Screen? 

I do not expect this information to be displayed on the Availability screen or Rebalance Screen. I expect this information to be displayed on a screen that has not yet been designed whose purpose will be to hold the following information.Site (Unit from operatorpxCreateOperator from Rebalance object)
Rebalance Date (pxCreateDateTime from Rebalance objectformatted mm/dd/yyyy)
Reason (new field on Rebalance Object)
Approver (Manager Operator Name from Rebalance Object entered free form)
Processor (pyUpdateOpName)

2014-12-20 16:44:39.3040 AuthoredAt is 2/19/2009 1:46:02 PM
2014-12-20 16:44:39.3040 Content is Rebalance Work Flow and Screen Shots 

Rebalancing Process Flow::

As of today we are having two separate links in the Rebalance 1)Change availability 2)Rebalance. For the ease of development we have broken it in to 2 stories.

But when the development is complete the Rebalance harness will have the following screens and flow. Please correct us if there is any deviation in the flow

Currently we have " View Reports" in the interaction manager. Do you want to include Rebalance reports as part of that or do you want to include it separtely in the Rebalance harness. Please confirm.

The flow mentioned below is based on the assumption that "reports" will be integral part of the rebalance harness. If we confirm us we will update the flow accordingly.

The Rebalance Portal will have two links
oRebalance



Rebalance :
When the user clicks the Rebalance the first screen will be the one where he enters the reasons to do rebalancing
Once the user enters the reasons and submits it will take the user to change availability screen where he/she enters the inputs and then clicks submit
Upon clicking submit the user will be taken to Rebalance screen where he does the rebalance. Before doing the rebalance the "view button" will be disabled. Once he clicks the rebalance button the userwill get a confirmation screen. On clicking "close" the user will be navigated back to "rebalance screen" and the "View Report" button will be activated.
When the user clicks theview report button he will be able to see the report for the rebalance which is done at that time



We designed the screen where we give input for doing the rebalance. Please review it and let us know if any further changes needs to be incorporated.

Please refer to the "Rebalance Screen Shot on 18-02-2009.doc" in the attachment section.

Regards
Tilak

2014-12-20 16:44:42.6390 AuthoredAt is 2/18/2009 11:06:55 PM
2014-12-20 16:44:42.6390 Content is Suppression logic clarification 

If the account has only a Borrower and no Co-Buyer,
then the options for suppression should only be None or Customer and the text should only refer to the Borrower.
If the account has a Borrower and a Co-Buyer,
then the option for suppresion should contain None, Customer, Co-Buyer, or both and the text should refer to both Borrower and Co-Buyer as appropriate.

c) Some of the rejections work basket created here will be used by Padma to route the Charge off work items (only HRC) as a part of the "Follow up for CSRP story".Business will help us identify the work basket that can have both SR and Charge off work items in the rejection work baskets

2014-12-20 16:44:56.4490 AuthoredAt is 2/24/2009 9:14:03 PM
2014-12-20 16:44:56.4490 Content is Some key discussion points while discussing the story-24-Feb 

All,
Just keeping a note of what we learnt about the story today:
a) Some of the CRM-Rejections work basket will be used for routing HRC type(only- Not applicable for total loss and special collection) charge off work items for follow up by Padma
b) As a direct result of a) there could be work items of both the type Charge off and a Service request that will be contained in the work basket. We should assume that the user knows how to sort out the SR/COD work items and do the follow up work as required.
c) Chris the collector will have access to all the SR or COD work items in a particular work basket if he has the required access to that work basket. We dont need to filter out the contents of the work basket based on role.
d) Once the follow up work is done and the follow up processor clicks on "Submit", the HRC work item will be approved(as already built in R1) and will go to the Process charge off work basket/
e) Charge off is only for US.

2014-12-20 16:45:00.5280 AuthoredAt is 2/25/2009 5:33:06 PM
2014-12-20 16:45:00.5280 Content is 25 Feb Clarifications 

Section 1 & Section 2:

For the skillet mappingnew SKILLSET table will be created in oracle with the following columns
Process
Primary Skill
Secondary Skills.

From the SAM_WORK table the process value will be picked up and it will be mapped to the SKILLSET table to get the skills corresponding to the process.

Clarification needed:For example -Incase If 100 users are selected for rebalancing, all the 100 values needs to be passed to the SQL query. I need to check whether PEGA is having any limitations to pass these user values

At the maximum of how many users can be selected during rebalancing.?
.

Section 4 :

2014-12-20 16:45:04.2020 AuthoredAt is 2/26/2009 11:59:07 PM
2014-12-20 16:45:04.2020 Content is Response to 25 Feb Queries 

1. Follow up requests from Padma should be sent to the Site_Workgroup_rejection workbasket for Chris the Collector.
2. Brad verified that the SHAW request XML Schema passes the ShawUserID which is the GMAC ID. In production, the SAM operator ID is also the GMAC ID. This will allow us to create the SR using the ShawUserID from the XML request and then turn around in Pega and do a look up of the Unit for that ID.
3. As far as we can see, the SHAW User ID is the GMAC ID and the Pega Operator ID is the GMAC ID and all of these are provided by CORE ID as part of the single sign on mechanism. As for CARS, I believe that they use a different identification mechanism.

2014-12-20 16:45:07.6000 Author is Member:15540
2014-12-20 16:45:07.7680 AuthoredAt is 2/27/2009 4:49:29 PM
2014-12-20 16:45:07.7680 Content is Availability vs. Rebalance clarification (Regards to operators query question) 

The two processes we have defined are 1) making an operator available or unavailable, or 2) rebalancing the work for one or more operators. In the case of #2, anytime an operator is selected, the work in that user's worklist that fits the status criteria will always be rerouted back to the routing workbasket, regardless if the operator is available or unavailable. When the items get routed from the Workbasket back to the worklists, then the rules that govern whether a user gets items is based on their availability.
Let me know if you have any questions on this.
Brad
2014-12-20 16:45:07.7680 Author is Member:4679

2014-12-20 16:45:18.3520 AuthoredAt is 3/2/2009 9:59:46 PM
2014-12-20 16:45:18.3520 Content is Answers to questions 

How would the Language of the letter come from?
Lsz response -The information for systematically generated letters had indicated that theLanguage Indicatorpassed from CARS would be leveraged.
a)At this time, from a COD letter perspective  only Branch 599 accounts where the Language Indicator is S or Spanish, the Spanish letter is generated.
b)The current SAM Document Generation menu system only presents the option for letter language based upon a manual selection at the time the letter is being generated.
c)Going forward, the frame work for the Document Generation perspective will need to offer the option for a letter to be generated in the language of the customers preference (French/English forCanadaor English/Spanish for US)


b)Matured/Not Matured Indicator come from CARS/Pega? Or do we continue to hard code it please?
Lsz response - The CARS fields necessary to determine if a vehicle term has matured or not is based upon the account type.
For Retail and Retail FFP Account Types, the Final-Pmt-Dt: in CARS the Estimated Final Payment Date: field which is mapped to the HOME tab in SAM.

If the letter is generated prior to this date, it is not considered matured. If it is generated on or after this date, the matured letter is generated.
For Lease Account Types in CARS, the SC-END field in CARS and in SAM on the HOME tab Scheduled End Date.
i.If the letter is generated prior to this date for lease agreement 8 contracts the unmatured letter is generated
ii.If the letter is generated on or after this date for lease agreement 8 contracts, the matured letter is generated.
iii.If the letter is generated prior to 29 days to this date for lease agreement 9 contract, the unmatured letter is generated
iv.If the letter is generated on or after the 28thday prior to this date for lease agreement 9 contracts, the matured letter is generated.
For SmartBuy and SmartBuy FFP Account Types in CARS, the SC-END field in CARS and in SAM on the HOME tab Scheduled End Date

If the letter is generated prior to this date, it is not considered matured. If it is generated on or after this date, the matured letter is generated. Unless the account is Renewed.
2014-12-20 16:45:18.3590 Author is Admin

2014-12-20 16:45:26.3790 Content is Clarification on using SIte no for routing to rejections workbasket 

All,
We understand the following routing logic for rejections work basket:
Main flow:
Please look out for the Unit and work group of the initiator who created this SR in SHAW (assuming he has been set up in SAM too) and use that combination to send it to the rejections workbasket
Alternative Flow
If the User id is not set up in SAM, use the Site no associated with the work item(this will come from SHAW) and use that to determine the rejections workbasket

Our question is that today the same site no is associated with more than 1 rejections workbasket.
For e.g. 311 as site no maps to
KnoxvilleAdministration Center
and
KnoxvilleCommercial Remarketing

Similarly for 684, 622,etc.
Now if we were to receive a SR where the user in SHAW is not set up in SAM , we will use the site no to determine which rejections workbasket to send the work item to. If the site no is 311, which rejections work basket do we send it to ? admin center or remarketing? Please correct us if our understanding is incorrect somewher and advise

2014-12-20 16:45:29.4570 AuthoredAt is 3/4/2009 12:15:37 PM
2014-12-20 16:45:29.4720 Content is Statuses for which rebalancing is done 

Jeff/Duane/Brad,
We got the following statuses from the database. We just want to confirm with you for what statuses we are going to do the rebalancing.

Active
Rebalance
Error: Flow Not At Task
Not taken into consideration
null
Not taken into consideration
Resolved-Completed
Not Rebalance
Open
Not Rebalance
Resolved
Not Rebalance
Pending Review
Rebalance
Error: Agent SLA Open
Not taken into consideration
New
Rebalance
Pending Follow Up
Rebalance
Pending-External
Rebalance
Pending Approval
Rebalance

ForError: Flow Not At Task, Null & Error: Agent SLA Openwe are not considering them as they are PEGA related error statuses.

ii.If the letter is generated on or after this date for lease agreement 8 contracts, the matured letter is generated.
iii.If the letter is generated prior to 29 days to this date for lease agreement 9 contract, the unmatured letter is generated
iv.If the letter is generated on or after the 28thday prior to this date for lease agreement 9 contracts, the matured letter is generated

2014-12-20 16:45:43.8020 Content is Addition of an business rule to the story 

All,
I had a discussion with the story owner to understand if there were any scenarios where the flow mentioned in the story should have any exceptions? The rationale behind asking this question was th understanding of how all the systems work in sync and why would we need to have an exception flow.
Jeannie told us that , if Padma selects follow up required as "YES" and clicks on Submit, we need not show the two pop up messages as outlined in the story and allow the work item/COD-SR to flow to the follow up work basket. Only if Padma does not select as follow up required, will we have one warning message popup saying "Did you check for outstanding personal property taxes if the garaging address or contract state = Alaska, Arkansas, Connecticut, Kentucky, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Missouri, North Carolina, Rhode Island, Texas, Virginia or West Virginia? and if Padma clicks on Yes again then "Did you check for outstanding open items". If padma selects a NO for any of these two questions we should not let her submit the work item/resolve it "if follow up required is NO".
Duane/Jeff,
Please let us know if this should go as a back log or should the team work on it as a part of this iteration?
Offshore team,

2014-12-20 16:45:47.1850 Content is Story elaboration 

In the process charge off screen, Padma has to select a value from the drop down from the list to determine whom the letter should be sent to(Mark Address undeliverable to). This has to be constructed dynamically based on whether or not the account has a co-buyer or not
Scene1: Both Buyer/Customer and Co-Buyer/Co- Customer are present for an account
The options padma would have are : None, Both, Co-Buyer, Buyer
Scene2:Only Buyer/Customeris present for an account
The options padma would have are : None(send the letter to the buyer only), Buyer(Do not send any letter)
We are assuming that each account will have atleast a customer associated.
Business,
Please review and let us know if anything is captured incorrectly.
Offshore team,
Please do any kind of analysis , if warranted and help us by completing this defect storyPlease let us know if there are more inputs required

2014-12-20 16:46:00.7030 AuthoredAt is 3/19/2009 4:05:58 AM
2014-12-20 16:46:00.7430 Content is confirmation for routing logic 

All,
We just wanted to confirm and proceed with the work on this story our following assumption:
a) Site no is going to be mandatory field for all SRs created out of SHAW.
b) If site no is present for a SR, we will use that information to determine the rejections workbasket else we will use the initiator's unit+ work group(this will be typically all SRs initiated in SAM)
c) There will never be a scenario where both the site no and Initiator's unit are both absent for a SR because Site no is mandatory and initiators information is present if a SR created in SAM. We dont have to program for any default routing in case either information is not available.

Please correct us if there is something that has been captured inaccurately.
Regards,
Akshat

2014-12-20 16:46:04.5020 AuthoredAt is 3/20/2009 4:34:13 AM
2014-12-20 16:46:04.5190 Content is Response to Confirmation for routing logic 

Team,
We had a discussion with Jeff D and following is the logic to be used for routing to rejections work basket:
a) To determine if a SR was created out of SHAW , we need to check if SHAWGUID!= Null
If SHAW GUID!=Null then we should understand that it is a SHAW generated SR (For a SR created out of SHAW , the GUID will never be null because it is a system generated value and is mandatory). We should use the site no = "Branch no"from one of the pages in clipboard to determine the rejections workbasket(this is a mandatory field too for all SRs coming out of SHAW)

If SHAW GUID = Null then we should understand that it is a SAM generated SR and we should then use the initiator's unit and work group information to determine the rejections workbasket.

There will be no scenario where both the initiator's unit and work group information and site no both will be absent . Hence we do not have to worry about creating a routing logic for a default scenario

Jeff D,
Thank you for helping us with the information. Please review and correct if required.

Offshore team,
Please let us know if any further inputs are required.

Regards,
Akshat


We know that any SR that is initiated from SHAW. There is a property on the pypage and if SHAW GUID != null then its a SHAW transaction. It is a mandatory field. If it exists then there is a property called branch id is the id to use for determining the rejections work basket.

Then we will use the operators unit and work group combinations

2014-12-20 16:46:14.8630 Author is Member:15542
2014-12-20 16:46:15.0670 AuthoredAt is 3/25/2009 4:00:19 AM
2014-12-20 16:46:15.0830 Content is Responses to letter suppression when buyer/co buyer are staying at the same residence 

Offshore team,
The answer to your question is posted below:

The logic to dynamically populate the mark Address undeliverable for drop down:

1)If Buyer and Co-Buyer are both applicable for an account and if they have different address:
a)The Drop down will all 4 values: Buyer, co buyer, none and both. The default selection being None.
b)the check box will be defaulted to the message that is corresponding to None
c)2 letters will be generated if None was selected

2)If Buyer and Co-Buyer are both applicable for an account and if they have sameaddress:
a)The Drop down will have only 2 values: None and both. The default selection being None.
b)the check box will be defaulted to the message that is corresponding to None
c)1 letter with both the names of buyer and co- buyer will be generated if None was selected

3)Only Ifa Buyer was applicable for an account :

a)The Drop down will have only 2 values: None and Buyer. The default selection being None.
b)the check box will be defaulted to the message that is corresponding to None
c)1 letter will be generated if None was selected

2014-12-20 16:46:37.4260 Author is Member:15541
2014-12-20 16:46:37.5870 AuthoredAt is 3/30/2009 8:32:54 PM
2014-12-20 16:46:37.6000 Content is Meeting Notes  (Comment)

The Signature Block consists of the following:
1.Blank space for the signature
2.Picture of the signature
3.Employee Name
4.Employee Title
5.Phone Number
6.Fax Number(Canadaonly, will be brand website for US)
7.Email address (Canadaonly)
Phone numbers can be broken out into 3 different categories:
1.Personalized
2.Generic
3.Overridden (Specialized)
Generic vs Personalized signature block to be define on the user profile in Pega.
If the user profile is set to generic, it should select the general phone number for the users site.
The Override (Specialized) signature block to be defined on a letter by letter basis.Examples would be where the presidents name and info appears on the letter, or bankruptcy letters that come from an individual.
The phone number has been moved from within the body of the letter to under the signature block
If the phone number is personalized on the letter, but the phone number is blank on the user profile, the phone number will default to the brand CSC.
Extension numbers only apply to national?If an extension number exists on the user profile, then the extension will be printed on the letter.If no extension number appears, then nothing will be printed on the letter.
Business is identifying the groupings of the letters so that they can define similar phone numbers to use for specific groups (for example, bankruptcy, collections, etc)
All phone numbers need to be table driven (so if changes occur, they can happen in one place w/o having to change multiple letters), but the rules to identify which number to use will have to be done on a letter by letter basis.Several phone numbers can be pulled from the IW (Information Warehouse).
Some wording on the story needs to change.Anywhere that refers to a generic phone number will be changed to general.
In reference to the account type, when the account type is a lease, retail, etc, the account type general phone number will appear on the letter.
There is one ARC inCanadaand one ARC in theUS.
How are envelops called in SAM when someone needs to locally print a letter?Does this mean when SAM is printing a return envelop?Click for local print in Pega doesnt appear to work well.Reprint should re-route back to the print vendor.
2014-12-20 16:46:37.6200 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:46:37.7970 AuthoredAt is 3/30/2009 8:33:38 PM
2014-12-20 16:46:37.7970 Content is Meeting Notes  (Comment)

Return Addresses, like phone numbers should be table driven, for quick and easy changes.
The rules to define which return address to use need to be defined on a letter by letter basis.
The return addresses will be listed on the master spreadsheet that Linda has created.
For PPC return addresses, we should leverage what is already built.
2 different types of return addresses are on the letter:
1.(brand) return address in top left corner of theletter.
2.Remittance address  where info (payments) get sent back to
Solution needs to be flexible enough to identify countries and make changes quickly
A change control process to make edits to letter information (return addresses, phone numbers, etc) will need to be developed.Will this process be in Pega?If so, maybe a control panel will need to be created to update any changes.However, if Pega were to get systematic feeds on a regular basis, the updates would come automatically instead of manually.TOG needs to have a technical spike with architects to see what the best solution would be.

Document groups may be tied to the naming conventions, but they mainly should be created based on roles and skills

2014-12-20 16:46:54.9770 AuthoredAt is 4/13/2009 2:43:23 PM
2014-12-20 16:46:55.0020 Content is Discussion with Brad on 10 April 2009 

Brad ,
I summarized all the points we discussed on 10 April , please correct me if Iam wrong.
As of now the manual Retrywill be delivered , thereport & auto retry will be delivered later.
For system errors the workitems will be routed to retry workbasket and the sustain team will be notified by email , the sustain team will run the retry activity which will resubmit all the workitems to Adobe.
For the application errors the processor will be notified by email and the processor will resume the flow after fixing the application error.
2014-12-20 16:46:55.0020 Author is Member:15855
2014-12-20 16:46:55.1790 AuthoredAt is 4/14/2009 2:53:41 AM
2014-12-20 16:46:55.2000 Content is Discussion with Brad on 10 April 2009 - Response 

The first two bullets are correct.
For the third bullet, we changed the process such that all errors will go to sustain. The reason is that 1) we should have data validation on the page prior to generating the letter, and 2) if we do have some data error, it will probably take a bit of time to figure out where the issue is. For now, let's generate the error email to Sustain only.

2014-12-20 16:47:12.9490 AuthoredAt is 5/15/2009 9:39:35 AM
2014-12-20 16:47:12.9610 Content is Queries 

Duane/Jeanne,
Please find below the list of questions that needs to be addressed as part of the story.
1. In Employee report, should the dropdown display only the list of Processors as Employees? The reason for asking this question is "updated from (Approved to Resolved)" will be applicable only for processors.

2. Let us consider the following scenario:
 a. A charge-off comes to the appoved state and stays in the common Process-Charge-Off Work basket for 24 hours.
 b. Then a processor takes the charge-off and resolves it in 5 minutes.
 c. Now if we consider the Process time as per the present logic, it isProcess Time = Resolved State time - Approved State time.
 ie., 24 hours and 5 minutes.
 d. Here the processor has taken only 5 minutes. However in the report it will show that the charge off took 24 hrs to be resolved and this will reflect in the average process time of the employee as well.
e. In a similar way if a processor starts workign on a work item that just came to process charge off work basket and resolves it in 1 hour then his process time is only 1 Hour. though the previous user resolved it in 5 minutes as we are adding the time that it stayed in the work basket his performance is not up to the mark. The reason for askingthis quesiton is as such the reports measures the productivity of a employee.

3. If after approved state, a charge off is sent for Req followup. Then it will come to approved state again. Now if it is resolved, do we have to consider process time as the time between the first time it came for approval(ignoring the second time it came for approval) and the time it got resolved? In this case also, without the fault of the employee, his/her average process time may show more in the report.
Please let us know if you need add inputs to address the same.
Regards
Tilak
2014-12-20 16:47:12.9790 Author is Member:15418
2014-12-20 16:47:13.1380 AuthoredAt is 5/15/2009 1:11:53 PM
2014-12-20 16:47:13.1600 Content is Response to 5/15 am Queries 

1. In Employee report, should the dropdown display only the list of Processors as Employees? The reason for asking this question is "updated from (Approved to Resolved)" will be applicable only for processors.

Yes, the dropdown should display only a list of Processors. Make sure that we include Employees that have "ProcessChargeOff" workbasket.


2. Let us consider the following scenario:
 a. A charge-off comes to the appoved state and stays in the common Process-Charge-Off Work basket for 24 hours.
 b. Then a processor takes the charge-off and resolves it in 5 minutes.
 c. Now if we consider the Process time as per the present logic, it isProcess Time = Resolved State time - Approved State time.
 ie., 24 hours and 5 minutes.
 d. Here the processor has taken only 5 minutes. However in the report it will show that the charge off took 24 hrs to be resolved and this will reflect in the average process time of the employee as well.
e. In a similar way if a processor starts workign on a work item that just came to process charge off work basket and resolves it in 1 hour then his process time is only 1 Hour. though the previous user resolved it in 5 minutes as we are adding the time that it stayed in the work basket his performance is not up to the mark. The reason for askingthis quesiton is as such the reports measures the productivity of a employee.


The Process Time should be calculated as Resolved State Time - Approved State Time even though this appears to have a negative impact on average process time for an individual employee. This report is used to find process issues and make improvements to overall processing time. Outliers on an individual operators report will be researched and discussed in an effort to determine whether overall process improvements or individual processor improvementscan be made.


3. If after approved state, a charge off is sent for Req followup. Then it will come to approved state again. Now if it is resolved, do we have to consider process time as the time between the first time it came for approval(ignoring the second time it came for approval) and the time it got resolved? In this case also, without the fault of the employee, his/her average process time may show more in the report.


Same answer as #2 above. Process Time should be calculated as Resolved State Time - Approved State Time (Initial Approval, not subsequent Approvals)

We will discuss these responses with Jeanne upon her return.
Regards
Jeff
2014-12-20 16:47:13.1770 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:47:14.3900 AuthoredAt is 3/7/2006 5:19:20 PM
2014-12-20 16:47:15.9060 Content is Performance Findings 

After some investigation the performance of the slow parsing xml rule was some declare expressions that existed on PricingRows class.
Rather than relying on declare expression to populate the PricingRows steps were added to the existing PostParse activity. The parsing of a 26 price grids went from 1.5 minutes to 4 seconds.
2014-12-20 16:47:15.9060 Author is Member:1026

2014-12-20 16:47:16.2010 Content is Additional Clarifications 

Thanks Jeff for the responses. I have one more question in reference to the discussion we had.
1. For instance Processor 1 picked up one work item from the process charge off work basketand found out that some additional information is required to resolve the work item and he sends for request follow up. The initiator/reviewer/approver who ever recieves the pending follow up work item, fills the additional details and sends for processor charge off.
2. What if Processor 2 instead of processor 1 picks up the work item from the process charge off work basket and start working up on it. how to calculate in this scenario as two processors are involved in this scenario. Is there any condition that the first processor who ever starts the working on a SR needs to finish up the work item as the work item after follow up will come to the workbasket and/or any processor can pick up the work item and work up on it.?
Please let us know.
Regards
Tilak
2014-12-20 16:47:16.2010 Author is Member:15418
2014-12-20 16:47:16.3810 AuthoredAt is 5/18/2009 12:44:22 PM
2014-12-20 16:47:16.4060 Content is Response to 5/18 question 

Because the report is to measure time from Approved to Resolved, the above scenario will have no effect. Once followup is completed on a work item and returned, it is Approved when it is returned to the Process Charge Off workbasket, so it wouldn't matter which processor selects the item to work it.
Jeanne

2014-12-20 16:47:23.0560 AuthoredAt is 5/22/2009 2:04:34 PM
2014-12-20 16:47:23.0770 Content is Responses 

1. The logic for the source document must be removed from the Uncollectible Amount field and linked to the new Uncollectible Adjustment field. There will no longer be a Reason for entry for the Uncollectible Amount field.
2. I have written a story to remove this field altogether, so the default can be left as blank.
3. Use the same edits that are used for the Collectible Amount and Uncollectible Amount fields.
4. The Adjustment field will always show.
5. The Uncollectible Amount field and the Uncollectible Adjustment field are not related to each other (only added together for reporting purposes). There will never be a negative amount in the field.
6. The same users who have access to enter/edit the Uncollectible Amount field.

2014-12-20 16:47:30.5870 Content is Clarification on Access Groups for Initiators & Processors 

In the COD rebalancing proces , the workitems has to be assigned to the right user goups along with the matchingskill sets.i.e. if we pick up one COD workitem for rebalacing, thefollowing sequence will be followed :1)Get the operator with the matching skill2)Check the operator's availability3)Check the operator's load4)Check the operator group (Initiator / Reviewer / Manager / processor)To decide the operator's group we are using the acess groupsInitiator - No specific access group/groups (but most of the initiators are in groups like Associatexor Associateplus)Reviewer - GMAC-SupervisorManager - GMAC-Managementprocessor- No specific access group/groupsCan we go ahead fix the accessGroups for initiators &processors ?If we use the workbasket check to decide on the processorit may end up with resource consumingimplementaion.------- Dev Team

2014-12-20 16:47:34.4070 Author is Member:1026
2014-12-20 16:47:34.6060 AuthoredAt is 3/15/2006 3:50:50 PM
2014-12-20 16:47:34.6150 Content is bulleted list of concerns and notes 

Concerns
notes about resolution given here

spaces disappearing
the current method (using a java step to split the flat file into lines) works just fine and spaces are preserved;
the exception is the trailing spaces of the T001 ("trailer") segment itself -- and it was decided we don't care.

graceful error handling
we need to investigate how to nicely deal with errors, particularly (a) reporting them back to the client and, more importantly (b) reporting all the errors we can, and not just stopping at the first problem...
I've found that it is relatively easy to trap the errors, and it doesn't take too much java to record the state information and continue; we should put out nice error messages, but that's another story

reading in XML w/o namespace(s)
I'm attempting to write a simple SOAP call to get in XML and correctly parse it; I think it will work, but I'd like to see the proof...

Value Debtor attorney First Name (43) same as Court Filing Party First Name (07)
Value Debtor Attorney Last Name (44) same as Court Filing Part Last Name (08)
Value Debtor Attorney Street Address 1 (45) same as Customer Street Address 1 (84)
Value Debtor Attorney Street Address 2 (46) same as Customer Street Address 2(85)
Value Debtor Attorney City (47) same as Customer City (86)
Value Debtor Attorney State (48) same as Customer State (87)
Value Debtor Attorney Zip (49) same as Customer Zip (88)

2014-12-20 16:48:06.3600 AuthoredAt is 7/6/2009 2:26:08 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:06.3780 Content is Need Enhancement Story 


Thanks for the feedback Linda.
For number 1 below, can you tell me what the business does currently with the leap years extra day? The current calculation doesnt take it into effect either. Im assuming that finance charges happen during that extra day as well. If that is the case then you are correct in that we should be taking that into account as well.
Rob, you have probably already read these comments from Linda regarding the Payoff Calculator. I know you were already working with Kelly on a few of these issues and were writing additional stories for them. When you write your additional stories you will want to make sure you are addressing Lindas comments in your enhancement stories so we dont need to write more stories later. It would also be a good idea if you take a look at the spreadsheets that Linda is referencing while writing the enhancement stories for the Payoff calculator as well if you already havent done so. That way we know we have all the angles covered.
Please let Linda or I know if you need help deciphering the spreadsheets.
Thanks,
Matt
Matt,
Thank you very much for providing the information that was contained in the Roseville Application. Upon review of the document my findings are:
The calculation is only applicable to FFP account and does not take into consideration the years where there is a leap year of 366 days.
The calculation is not for Traditional Account types where we could have actuarial calculations or rule of 78ths calculations.
The calculation will not function properly for the SmartBuy FFP account types when the balloon payment becomes matured
It was my understanding that the various excel spreadsheets that are used by the various business teams, which was supposed to include the Bankruptcy team were going to be built in SAM to address the situations where we were not able to obtain a payoff quote from CARS.
Beth and/or Theresa, please advise if I should be providing the PSS team with the various Excel spreadsheets  rebate magic, Rebate Calculator, FFP Magic, FinChargsPaid to leverage for this activity.
Thank you. 
Linda
