2014-12-20 16:48:10.3200 Content is Suggetions for the Report From Linda  (Comment)

Based on the discussion, below is summary of the suggestions on the Story-04497 (Charge off Letters Report):
1.Keep the report name as Charge off Letters.
2.The value State in the Sum By drop list should be State/ Province.
3.In the summary view of the report, reduce the column width of the column; No. of Letters. This will help the user view the total number of letters without any scroll in the right direction.
4.Change the column header Branch # to Brand. A separate column for Branch # is not required as the first 3 digits in the account number indicate the Branch.
5.Place a column Customer Type before the column Customer Name. The values displayed in this column will be Customer or Co Customer based upon the type of customer.
6.Change the column headers of the following columns:
1.Customer/ Co Customer Name to Name.
2.Customer/ CoCustomerStateto State.
3.Customer/ Co Customer Zip to Zip.
4.Customer/ Co Customer Country to Country.

Ariel is preparing and reviewing/modifying selected data fields related to the reaffirmation agreement (form) so it can be sent to customers attorney or pro se debtor.This agreement is sent in order to maintain filers liability to the loan/asset once bankruptcy discharges. 2014-12-20 16:48:17.6990 AuthoredAt is 7/20/2009 12:44:38 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:17.7200 Content is Clarification Request from Raman on 7/17 

S-05115 -Paid in Full Electronic Title Account Search Generic

1. The total of the unpaid charges, unpaid late charges and / or unpaid extension fee of <=$1.00, then we need to show Electronic title, Lien
 Satisfaction, Electronic Title Dealer/Third Party Options to User, Also in Case of PaidInfull Thank you letter the condition is total of the unpaid
 charges, unpaid late charges and / or unpaid extension fee = $0.00, We need to show this option.

Therefore, as per the above conditions which means that if it is $0.00 we need to show all 4 Options to User, Is the Understanding correct.

lsz response:All of the Paid In Full Electronic Title and Lien Release should reflect OSB <=$0.00 and total unpaid charges, unpaid late charges and / or unpaid extension fee of <=$1.00, then the letter qualifies for generation.I apologize if the values are not consistent across the stories.
Please clarify what you are referring to as all 4 Options

2. When referring Registration State ( which is eitherContractStateor customer mailing state), understanding is that ifContractStateis available thenwe will take that first, if not available then we need to refer to customer mailing state,Is the understanding correct.

lsz response:This is correct, however there must be a method available for the user to override the mailing state information, as CARS does not pass the registration state information to SAM for the lien release or the electronic title.Also, do not forget that the GAP, Credit Insurance is based upon the contract state.
3. In the Story, we are referring that , When account is searched & has Title code 12, 13 & 14and/or contract state/customer mailing state is AZ, CA, ID, MA, SC, VA,FL, HI or NY..... ,
Can you explain the Title Code values here ?
lsz response:Title codes are values that are supposed to be passed from CARS to SAM.They will be leveraged for identifying when the Electronic Title will be available, however the user must be able to select between Electronic Title and Lien Satisfaction even with the Title codes in place, as not all of the parameters to identify qualification between electronic title and lien satisfaction are currently available.

2014-12-20 16:48:17.8950 AuthoredAt is 7/20/2009 12:48:28 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:17.9130 Content is 5120 Clarification Question from Raman - 7/17/2009 

4. As per the Story, When user selects <Electronic Title Dealer / Third Party> the user will be presented with the option to select "To Dealer" or "To Third Party", uponselection of "To Third Party", the user will be presented with the third party letter, where the addressee and address information will contain all editable fields for the User to enter, the Address Name, Addressee Name2 (Attention), Address, City, State, Zip.

Here when we are referring to the editable fields as Dealer Name, Address, city , state & zip, Is this correct?
lsz response:This is correct, the dealer information must be editable fields as well.

From:Frolick, Elizabeth M.
Sent:Tuesday, July 07, 2009 9:39 AM
To:Carlson, Janet;Athalye, Shardul
Cc:Thomas, Theresa;Balog, Robert;Carlson, Laura;Steinle, Tom; Boyajian, Michelle;Carter, Duane
Subject:RE: Issue for SAM Program Log
Jan,

I really appreciate you using this issue log to document program items. It enables a program level discussion on these items. We should not prevent Canadian accounts from being set up anywhere in SAM. There is Canadian functionality in SAM (both Account Servicing and MI) and this needs to continue to exist. It sounds like there are two issues here:

First, there may be a bankruptcy project issue where Canadian bankruptcy accounts are not appropriate for theUSfunctionality were building and the users are asking that that be systematically enforced. If that was not originally in scope, but is key business functionality, then we need to use the agile methodology to change scope (understanding that we cannot add this to scope and meet our dates without removing equivalent scope in other places).

The second is that there are security enhancements that should have been deployed as part of COD which were removed from scope. One of those items was to prevent US users from creating SRs on Canadian accounts and visa versa, while allowing a read only view into each others country. This is on the backlog for inclusion as some future point in SAM.


Thanks,
Beth

Semperian
Director StrategicPlanning
Office: 248-948-6054
Cell: 248-765-0889
Fax: 248-948-6517
elizabeth.frolick@gmacfs.com

2014-12-20 16:48:39.8930 AuthoredAt is 7/28/2009 2:37:52 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:39.9200 Content is Meeting Notes  (Comment)

Return Addresses, like phone numbers should be table driven, for quick and easy changes.
The rules to define which return address to use need to be defined on a letter by letter basis.
The return addresses will be listed on the master spreadsheet that Linda has created.
For PPC return addresses, we should leverage what is already built.
2 different types of return addresses are on the letter:
1.(brand) return address in top left corner of theletter.
2.Remittance address  where info (payments) get sent back to
Solution needs to be flexible enough to identify countries and make changes quickly
A change control process to make edits to letter information (return addresses, phone numbers, etc) will need to be developed.Will this process be in Pega?If so, maybe a control panel will need to be created to update any changes.However, if Pega were to get systematic feeds on a regular basis, the updates would come automatically instead of manually.TOG needs to have a technical spike with architects to see what the best solution would be.

2014-12-20 16:48:53.0300 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:48:53.1820 AuthoredAt is 8/3/2009 2:06:31 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:53.1820 Content is CARS Fields LI/DI Response 

The requirements are stated that the LI DI field is populated with a dollar figure the account will qualify. There are a number of fields that would be taken into consideration for the qualification of LI and/or DI.

The Original Amount and Indicator fields are populated if the customer purchased the warranty at contract signing. There are instances, during the life of the contract where the fields and indicators are updated, therefore,if the account indexed only contains the LI or DI original information, then the applicablefields should be used. If there is a value that is reflected as Current that is different than the original amount, then those fields should be leveraged, as something happened during the life of the contract that adjusted the value.
2014-12-20 16:48:53.1910 Author is Member:15541
2014-12-20 16:48:53.3460 AuthoredAt is 8/3/2009 2:08:24 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:53.3610 Content is OSB - Cars Field Response 

The current outstanding balance field would be leveraged for the paid in full letters. The original outstanding balance field contans the original amount the customer financed with GMAC, which does not change as the customer makes payments. The current outstanding balance field updates based upon the customer payment history through-out the life of the contract.

2014-12-20 16:48:53.5320 Author is Member:15541
2014-12-20 16:48:53.6870 AuthoredAt is 8/3/2009 2:47:45 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:53.6870 Content is Understanding of Story Response 


Please note that we discussed this at length regarding how the Amount Still Due letters will function. I had indicated during that conversation, that it may be easier for the team to create the letters for Amount Still Due and another set of letters for Refund Amount. Since there continues to be some confusion between which letter content is presented following issome additional detail. Please email me or we can leverage a meeting to go over the requirements, if there continues to be questions regarding these letters.

The amount still do letter will pull in the information from the account where if there is a rebate or refund from the payoff quote screen, which results in total amount which is a negative value on the letter  the content of the letter changes from amount still due to refund amount.

If the total amount reflected for the letter is a positive value, the amount still due verbiage is leveraged.

2014-12-20 16:48:56.5260 Author is Member:15541
2014-12-20 16:48:56.6920 AuthoredAt is 8/3/2009 2:54:23 PM
2014-12-20 16:48:56.7090 Content is Title Code Confirmation Response 

The story that this discussion point is associated wiht is Paid In Full Electronic Title Account Search Generic. As outlined in this story, the qualifications do include the title code.

If the story was regarding the lien satisfaction letters, the title codes listed for electronic title would be excluded as letters that qualify.

However, with that said, the title code is not the only field that needs to be applied to make the Electronic Title or Lien Satisfaction letters qualify. It is a combination of the Registration State and Title code that determines which release letter is generated be it Electronic Title or Lien Satisfaction.

QuestionClarificationWhere do we give the option to generate letter? Is it under select intent or under select intent-> document gen-> account management?This is not a new approach, so hopefully this type of question is put to rest with the following clarification:
Yes, the process is: Document Generation
Account Management is selected, then the letter is available based upon the account type searched uponCSC Associates ( various locations ) only for resend within good thru dates  What do we incur by good thru datesThe payoff quote that is processed will have a payoff good through date. However, with that said, since the reprint functionality is something that is available for all letters. Please advise what impact this is to the timeline.
Lsz will follow-up with business to confirm this need based upon the existing Document Generation Framework approach that has been established for the letter reprint functionality.Please let us know how to identify the users that needs access to the manual pay off quote letters?The manual payoff quote process is currently completed outside of SAM. There will be a need, if the fields that are necessary to properly populate the letter are not available from CARS, the user will be able to enter the information in the fields.
Once that information is entered in SAM, the fields will be mapped to the letter and available on the wireframe for confirmation.Do we need a validation when a CSC agent can resend it?(through good dates)lsz to follow-up with final decision regarding this.We understand that while a CSC selects the addresse as dealer, the address of customer and co customer(if available) will be displayed also()While anyagent that has access to the letter, not specific to CSC.

The letter generation rules for buyer / co buyer continue to apply, so if the selection is made for this, the solution offered as part of the Lien Release could be leveraged.

If the selection is made that the addressee is the selling dealership, the dealer information is leveraged from the account. Again the Lien Release solution offered could be leveraged.

Make this overall story consistent with the solution established for the Lien Release including the same options.How does one determine whether CARSis able to generate the quote and hence map? Is it based on a value of a certain field , which when nullThe payoff quote information from CARs is mapped in SAM. The team should already have access to the code, as this is in production. If not, then the WiPro team must work with the ITG team to walk through where the information is currently mapped.We are assuming that this is applicable only for AI? Pls confirm? Do we need to enable/disable the letter generation option?This is a letter that is available for AI searches only.

Yes, the letter should not be available for selection when an account is on the PI searchDo we need an intermediate screen to select the receipient address?Leverage the intermediate screen used for the Lien Release solution.Which field in CARS has net amount , daily dollar amount?Outstanding Balance, Late Charges Due (taken from Unpaid Late Charges field), Finance Charges Due, Finance Charges Deferred.
The system must total any unpaid extension fee, unpaid charges and/or additional charges. We need to map them to cars fieldThe payoff quote information from CARs is mapped in SAM. The team should already have access to the code, as this is in production. If not, then the WiPro team must work with the ITG team to walk through where the information is currently mapped.Do we need to incorporate any validations for the editable fields and whatare they?Is the visual basics information available? This should be leveraged to detemine the validation codes.

Also, there will be a difference between if the fields are populated in the wireframe based upon the CARS quote screen being available or manual entries made by a user. If the us

2014-12-20 16:49:47.0820 AuthoredAt is 10/7/2009 10:54:55 PM
2014-12-20 16:49:47.1020 Content is Same address comparison 

Noted from discusion with Linda.
The document should only generate one letter when there are two recipeints, such that their relationship categories are Buyer-Lessee and CoBuyer-CoLessee. The toLine2 will contain the name of the CoBuyer-CoLessee.
In no other case will the recipients need to be combined into one letter. eg. Buyer-Lessee and Guarantor. In this case it will generate two seperateletters.
If there are 3 or more addressees a letter will be generated for all three.

2014-12-20 16:50:12.6740 Author is Member:15418
2014-12-20 16:50:12.8300 AuthoredAt is 10/14/2009 12:31:58 PM
2014-12-20 16:50:12.8580 Content is 14 OCT Queries 

Update from Linda.
When we do not have a name in the letters there is a rule that indicates that the following salutation is used:
1.The Salutation for Dear Customer is:
1."Dear Customer:" - English
2.Estimado cliente - Spanish
3.Madame, Monsieur," (French)
2.The Salutation for Dear Applicant is an applicant
1.Dear Applicant  English
2.Estimado solicitante  Spanish
3.Madame, Monsieur,"ChercandidatFrench
3.The Salutation for when the Attention field is completed is populated with the information entered
1."Dear <Attention Field> - English
2.Estimado <Attention Field> - Spanish
3.Madame, Monsieur," (French) (Do not include the Attention Field)
4.The Salutation for when the Attention field is not completed and the Dear Customer rule does not apply;
1.To Whom It May Concern  English
2.A quien pueda concernir IT - Spanish
3. qui de droit,Personnes to IT droit porte-French

2014-12-20 16:50:31.0250 AuthoredAt is 10/22/2009 6:39:57 AM
2014-12-20 16:50:31.0370 Content is Logic Updated 22 OCT 

We had a discussion with Linda about all business logic we need to consider for the no Interest letter. It just got SIMPLER.

a)For PI accounts: For any account that is pulled out of SAM after PI search, we will show them the option to generate the no interest letter.
b)For AI accounts: Any account pulled out of AI search where only the OSB= 0 can have this letter generated.
c) For AI lease accounts: Any account searched upon using AI, the letter is available. (The solution is not tied to the OSB = $0.00)

2014-12-20 16:50:35.8050 AuthoredAt is 10/26/2009 6:08:58 AM
2014-12-20 16:50:35.8050 Content is Screen layout for the CANAM letter 

All,
While making the wireframe for this CANAM letter, please ensure that following is available on Wireframe:
LI - If the $ value is not =0 from SAM clipboard, then please keep this checkbox selected(with the options for the user to uncheck it). Keep a text box enabled next to it to be able to enter the service provider's name(this is mandatory if check box is selected). If its=0, then give the option to the user to select the checkbox. If this value is not selected , the text box for entering the service provider information is non-editable/Blank
MI- If the $ value is not =0 from SAM clipboard, then please keep this checkbox selected(with the options for the user to uncheck it). Keep a text box enabled next to it to be able to enter the service provider's name(this is mandatory if check box is selected).If its=0, then give the option to the user to select the checkbox. If this value is not selected , the text box for entering the service provider information is non-editable/Blank
OI-If the $ value is not =0 from SAM clipboard, then please keep this checkbox selected(with the options for the user to uncheck it). Keep a text box enabled next to it to be able to enter the service provider's name(this is mandatory if check box is selected).If its=0, then give the option to the user to select the checkbox. If this value is not selected , the text box for entering the service provider information is non-editable/Blank
DI-If the $ value is not =0 from SAM clipboard, then please keep this checkbox selected(with the options for the user to uncheck it). Keep a text box enabled next to it to be able to enter the service provider's name(this is mandatory if check box is selected).If its=0, then give the option to the user to select the checkbox. If this value is not selected , the text box for entering the service provider information is non-editable/Blank
GAP-If the $ value is not =0 from SAM clipboard, then please keep this checkbox selected(with the options for the user to uncheck it). Keep a text box enabled next to it to be able to enter the service provider's name(this is mandatory if check box is selected). If its=0, then give the option to the user to select the checkbox. If this value is not selected , the text box for entering the service provider information is non-editable/Blank
Dynamic rows(expandable/collapsable with an option to add/delete row, and a maximum of 4):
XM Radio - Please keep this an option for user to select. If this is selected , it is mandatory to enter the service provider name
OnStar- Please keep this an option for user to select. If this is selected , it is mandatory to enter the service provider name
Other1(label name may change)-Please keep this an option for user to select by clicking on add row. If this is selected , it is mandatory to enter the service provider name.This is not a mandatory field
Other2(label name may change)--Please keep this an option for user to select by clicking on add row. If this is selected , it is mandatory to enter the service provider name. This is not a mandatory field

The user should have an option at any time to deselect any of the check boxes and should be able to add/delete rows for the 4 fields mentioned above i.e. OnStar,XMRadio,Others1, Others2

To offshore on 10/26: Please review the above information and come up with questions if any

The only time I will be addressing fulfillment options will be based upon exception management. If the story does not call out exceptions the normal rules for fulfillment options apply:
1) Personalize profile has all of the options (however the Title Vendor fulfillment option is hidden at this time.)
2) Generic profile has only the Print Vendor fulfillment option.
Please make a note of this, so we do not have to cover this question on a letter by letter basis.

Q1)The story says that the direct refund states letter is not generated for PI accounts?Yes for all variations. None of the Cancellation aftermarket are generated for a PI accoun
Q2)Please provide the differences for including the GMPP paragraph on the letter. The GMPP paragraph which is shown in the sample of letter is only available for GMAC brand and FIS 00, at this time.Allow the user to select that the GMPP applies to the letter or not on the wireframe and based on the selection, the GMPP paragraph will be inserted in the generic version of cancellation aftermarket letter
Q3)When all fields LI,MI,DI,OI & GAP has value ==0 and if user doesn't selectnone of them in screen, what should be the response from system?
a.Is it error message in screen asking user to select anyone of those? - No error message, let the letter be generated if none of the values are selected too
b.Should we restrict access to this letter itself at variance selection screen,provided if none of these fields have value >0- NO, the select intent should only have the logic to determine if the letter is available to be built for smartlease and smartbuy. No other check is required
Q4)Please confirm the languages for the letters that are applicable.Do you have samples for: US Spanish  will not be available
Canadian English, Canadian French? Linda has written a follow up note to ask SMEs for canadian letters
5.Please confirm if SmartLease references are only applicable to GMAC account type brandsyes
6.Please confirm if SmartBuy references are only applicable to GMAC account type brandsyesChrysler on GMAC contract(so gmac for us)
7.Please confirm if lease references can apply to any other brand that is a Lease account typeyes
8.Please confirm if balloon reference can apply to any other brand that is a Balloon account typeyes
5.Include:Up to 4 other options on the wireframe rather than 2. It would be great if we can have other1, other2, other3, other4 i.e. 4 extra fields that can come by clicking on add row. If possible please provide an option for the user to edit "other1", other n...

2014-12-20 16:50:54.1850 Content is skill set required to generate this letter 

team,
Please build a skill set to control the access at the letter level. The name of the skill should be
"DG_Notification_SchEndExp_US"(Please use the label of the skill in consistent format/naming convention as used for PIF letters in R1/R2) for US users - the user with this skill set can generate a US ENGLISH and SPANISH letter
"DG_Notification_SchEndExp_CA" "(Please use the label of the skill in consistent format/naming convention as used for PIF letters in R1/R2) forCA users- the user with this skill set can generate a Canadian english and French letter.
This is applicable for all Schedule end expiry notifications irrespective of the account types(Linda - please let us know if you disagree)

for this letter, the following rule applies
US and Canadian users may look up accounts that originate in the other countries.
2)US users cannot make changes for the accounts that originate inCanada, nor generate letters
3)Canadian users cannot make changes for the accounts that originate in theUS, nor generate letters
4)USorigination country customer may have a Canadian address (or a military address for that matter).- in this case, a US user can generate letter for this customer but not the canadian
5)Canadian origination country customer may have anUSaddress

2014-12-20 16:50:57.7150 AuthoredAt is 11/4/2009 5:29:21 AM
2014-12-20 16:50:57.7310 Content is Queries raised on 02nd nov 

QuestionsResponsesHow does an agent know that the account qualifies for extension, we believe that it's an offline process or we need to look at indicators?, please confirm?There is no systematic method currently available in SAM to generate when this letter would qualify and when it would not. Based upon this, the letter will be available for the accounts that are on the AI screen for retail and balloon account types.How does one determine the bankruptcy status and hence thevariation change based on bankruptcy status? -lsz - The decision table requirements outline is in story 5460 in SAM regarding how one would determine if an account is in bankruptcy status or not.Samples are missing. I understand that Jeff may have sent it to you for youre review. But we would need the approved samples by EOD today/tomorrow pls.lsz - As previously indicted, if you have the samples from the Word document, then they are sufficient and I do not have to review them.Liability: Has customers obligation been discharged through bankruptcy?If the 15-18 bankruptcy code is updated to reflect a discharged 15-18 code, SAM will systematically identify and default the response to the Discharged question to yes.If the 15-18 bankruptcy code is not updated then the system must allow the user to select Discharged or Not Discharged.This will be on wireframe, correct?lsz - The system should reflect the option for the user to select yes or no for the discharged bankruptcy and then the proper letter content presented based upon the option selected.There will be no default for this item.

With that said, if the account, based upon the story requirements from 5460, is in an active bankruptcy status, the system should insert the bankruptcy paragraph in the letterWhat is the logic to identify the weekly/fortnightly payments?lsz - At this time there is no logic available in SAM.Number of Days Extended  (Since SAM does not currently have the EQ / EQS or MEQ fields mapped, the various extension quote fields will be user entered, at this time.) when mapping is available the CARS field name is:DAYS-TO-EXTEND: field and populate on the wireframe / letter.(This field must be editable)(This field is editable) .This will always be a user editable, correct?lsz - At this time the field will be editable for the user to enter the number of days extended.1. This letter applies for GMAC, National, Nuvell, and Suzuki brands for US accounts - how about canadian accounts?language variations?lsz - This letter applies to Canada and there are several stories available in Version One that outline this.I am following up with the Canadian SMEs for additional clarification for the story.Any specific requirements for fulfillment options?As previously discussed, the story will only call out exceptions.If there are no exceptions identified the basic design applies.So, based upon this requirement, since the story does not call out any exceptions the requirements are that all fulfillment options are available for the US and Canadian users, the Title Vendor is hidden and the Print Vendor only option is available for the Off Shore or Non GMAC Vendor employees.Based on the earlier conversations, we should not be having the stories no 5432 and no 5433 in scope because they are referring to Smart buy and spanish.Story 5432 Payment Management Extension - SmartBuy/Balloon US Spanish - is not available for build at this time and will be placed in the backlog
Story 5433 Payment Management Extension - SmartBuy / Balloon FFP US Spanish - is not available for build at this time and will be placed in the backlog.

2014-12-20 16:51:05.8890 AuthoredAt is 11/5/2009 1:06:15 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:05.9240 Content is inputs received on 04 nov 

Extensions is editable

Traditional account- charges for extensions are editable

Late charges due- pre populated with late charges based on the cars mapping and editable

Other charges- unpaid charges, extension fees, -all pre populated and editable like pay off quote but do not include OSB.

The total of all the above would be SubTo-total1

total to be paid up now= sub total1 + charges for extensions

Next regular schedule payment with a $value  pre populated and editable
Due date- next payment due date from sam/cars, - pre populated and editable
APR- editable

7 payments of $800 due->
No of payments- extended -> label for 7(This is coming in SAM)
The no of installments table is mapped into SAM. This is collapsible / dynamic and the content comes from Sam home page

Its either weekly, monthly- mapped in SAM already. We cant 100% rely on indicator so use valid value.(However based on conversation in the afternoon today)

Put a spreadsheet/mock up for the extensions (turn this around today if possible- Akshat)

We dont need separate samples for traditional and FFP for bankruptcy. The content is same if the bankruptcy para needs to be added

If the account is has filed for bankruptcy (with one of the indicators coming back)

Whether or not the customer has been discharged or not? On wireframe yes/no on the wire frame. Show this option only if the Bankrupcty indicator is Yes/No

If discharged is selected on wireframe add,
Because of your bankruptcy, you do not have to pay anything more on this account. However, if you choose not to continue to pay the amounts owed on this account, the vehicle may be taken from you.

If not discharged
To the extent that your obligation is discharged through bankruptcy, you will not have to pay anything more on this account. However, if you choose not to continue to pay the amounts owed on this account, the vehicle may be taken from you

Else
The generic sample
In select variant? - > just one Extensions


Mockto be provided by akshat.

Accounts with an 800 status will offer the user to select In Bankruptcy Yes or No, (Note: preferably this information is captured as part of the wireframe)

If Yes is selected, the bankruptcy letter rules apply and the user must select discharged Yes or No to apply the proper Bankruptcy fragment based upon the selection made.

If No is selected, the bankruptcy letter rules do not apply and the user will not be required to make the selection discharged Yes or No, this option will not be visible on the wireframe, nor will the Bankruptcy fragment be inserted into the letter.

d)Scheduled Payments: the scheduled payment amount mapped from the Home page of the Payments Remaining:
e)Pre-Authorized Payment Plan: Mapped from HS&Ts Billing and Banking Info Billing Status

I would suggest that we have a different place holder for these 5 elements under the pay off quote area. It should be dynamic and as seperate from the pay off quote because it is not logically connected to the pay off quote calculations.
All these fields are editable.There are no other business rules here.None of the 5 fields mentioned above will be sent to Adobe letter. Adobe letter does not change.Adobe team- Please replace2) Pay off quote- Canada- retail- FrenchPega team- No changes from the UI perspective except that the user can change the language selection and the section/place holder to contain the 5 data elements mentioned above comes on wireframeonly when there is a canadian account and the letter is generated for a dealerAdobe team-We will provide you the updated samples. 2014-12-20 16:51:16.6450 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:51:16.8220 AuthoredAt is 11/12/2009 4:31:24 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:16.8410 Content is inputs received on 12 nov 

The letters that identify theSpecificStatesamples of the letter require the signature on the letter is specific to the customers signature, so the letter will qualify for the Print Vendor fulfillment option.
Based upon this requirement, if the letter requires the signature two copies of the letter are generatedone for the customer to keep and one for the customer to return. In those situations the return envelope code will be included, should the fulfillment option of Print Vendor be selected.
Also, please refer the document Extension.info for rules per letter

THis is applicable for all Extensions stories covered in iteration 3

2014-12-20 16:51:22.6530 AuthoredAt is 11/16/2009 5:28:07 AM
2014-12-20 16:51:23.9280 Content is spanish translation for bankruptcy logic 

In response to the need for a Spanish translation to the Bankruptcy language in the extension letters for when a customer has not been discharged from bankruptcy, here is the translation:
"To the extent that your obligation is discharged through bankruptcy, you will not have to pay anything more on this account. However, if you choose not to continue to pay the amounts owed on this account, the vehicle may be taken from you"
Spanish translation:
Cuando su deuda es condonada mediante una quiebra, usted no tendr que pagar nada ms para esta cuenta. Sin embargo, se le podr quitar el vehculo si decide no continuar pagando las sumas adeudadas para esta cuenta.
this is applicable to all spanish stories
2014-12-20 16:51:23.9330 Author is Admin

According to the attached sample field updated in the MT application form are :

Registered Owner - prepopulated with the buyer / co-buyer names
Amount of Security - Original Amount Financed (editable field.)  AMOUNT OF LIEN on the existing letter will be replacedwith AMOUNT OF SECURITY
Security Party Name:LIENHOLDER NAMEon the existing letter will be replaced with Security Party Name:
We would not update existing content of the letter other than above listed fields.
2014-12-20 16:51:24.5110 Author is Member:18216
2014-12-20 16:51:24.6780 AuthoredAt is 11/17/2009 12:22:26 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:24.6880 Content is solution 

Currently in Lien Release if registration state is CO, we are using Lien Release generic letter. As per updated requirement, if registration state is CO and letter is addressed to Secretaryof State (or) DMV [Department of Motor Vehicles] then the updated letter is used.
The letter sent to other recipients remains unchanged (generic content).
New recipients (Secretary of State/DMV) would be added to the flow if the state is CO. A new template would be built with provided content:
Notice is given that (Brand Name) hereby notes satisfaction of the lien held by (Brand Name) due to payment and satisfaction of the underlying obligation.(Brand Name) certifies, under penalty of perjury to the second degree, that its signature releases and transfers its interest in the vehicle to the owner, (customer name).
This template is loaded for the combination of state (CO) and recipient (Secretary of State/DMV).

2014-12-20 16:51:28.2060 AuthoredAt is 11/19/2009 3:35:20 AM
2014-12-20 16:51:28.2060 Content is inputs on 18nov 

All the business rules followed for Pay off quote retail data elements will remain the same. Only 2 fields from the screen shot attached will be on/mapped tothe letter.
a) Good through date
b) Net amount
These fields are calculated exactly the same way as they are calculated for pay off quote -retail. The only difference is that only 2 fields are mapped on the letter. If a field is mapped/editable/user entered etc in pay off quote, it will remain exactly the same as that for shortage due. THe wireframe does not change except the section header which instead of saying Pay off quote details , it will say "Shortage due details".
However, the "fax no" and "fax to" fields which are currently applicable only for Canadian English- Dealer variation(not customer variation) will be dropped for shortage due wireframe. Also, based on comment from Linda, it is recommended that we drop these 2 fields from wireframe for both pay off and shortage due. This update is because we have Fax To and FAX# as a part of the fulfillment options already.

This letter is generated only for retail account based on Document template tool. Linda- Please let us know if this is not correct

The rest of the fields are applied using the account type, etc that was built for the Payoff Quote Letters.
Beth and Bev  Please advise if you agree or disagree with this approach. If you disagree, then provide the business requirements that should be applied.<Conformation pending from business SMEs>
2.We have some fields which will be visible for Canadian accounts only. So we are assuming that we will not show these fields in shortage due letter. Please confirm. For reference we have marked the fields on above screens which will come for Canadian accounts only.
lsz  This letter is not available for the Canadian users at this time, due to no story being received

to todetail out further here,

a) The workflow for shortage due for a retail traditional account is exactly the same as the one for pay off quote retail traditional. All the screen layout/data elements/business rules are exactly same as pay off quote. The only difference is that only2 fields, Net amount(as calculated for payoffquote retail traditional) andgood through date((as calculated for payoffquote retail traditional) is mapped on the letter.

b) The workflow for shortage due for a retailFFP account is exactly the same as the one for pay off quote for retail FFP.All the screen layout/data elements/business rules are exactly same as pay off quote. The only difference is that only2 fields, Net amount(as calculated for payoffquote retail FFP) andgood through date((as calculated for payoffquote retail FFP) is mapped on the letter.

c) The workflow for shortage due for a Balloon traditional account is exactly the same as the one for pay off quote balloon traditional. All the screen layout/data elements/business rules are exactly same as pay off quote. The only difference is that only2 fields, Net amount(as calculated for payoffquote balloon traditional) and good through date((as calculated for payoffquote balloon traditional) is mapped on the letter.

d) The workflow for shortage due for a BalloonFFP account is exactly the same as the one for pay off quote for balloon FFP.All the screen layout/data elements/business rules are exactly same as pay off quote. The only difference is that only2 fields, Net amount(as calculated for payoffquote balloon FFP) andgood through date((as calculated for payoffquote balloon FFP) is mapped on the letter.

With the following exceptions,
a) There is no dealer varationa
b) Since there is no story in v1, obviously, there is no canada variation and obviously the data elements specific to canada pay off quotewill be no where on the screen.
c) Unit and workgroup combinations have not yet been confirmed by SMEs.this was confirmed on 20 nov

Only for account that has OSB>0 with the required skills , account type and unit and workgroup (provided in v1)
The skill name has been provided. The unit and work group information is in V1 and confirmed. The rule for account qualification in addition to the above is that it should be eithera Retail/Balloon(both traditional/ffp) account and osb>0

2014-12-20 16:51:36.1660 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:51:36.6020 AuthoredAt is 3/31/2006 6:51:41 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:38.7790 Content is Completion notes 

The bug was in the logic surrounding the building of the tree. The "id" of each node on the tree used to be the name of the node (the one visable to the user). If you had 2 nodes with the same name when the user clicked on either one the system would find only the first one and expand/contact that. This was true even across the Rule and Exceptions Domain. If you expaned a node on the Exceptions domain it might appear to do nothing but when you switched back to the Rules Domain it would show that trees node as expanded/contacted.

I updated the HTML (DSEDomExpGroup, DSEDomExpGroupExceptions, DSEDomExpInner and DSEDomExpInnerExceptions) to use an ID that takes the name, a 'counter" and a rule/exp flag to ensure it is always unique.

2014-12-20 16:51:43.2440 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:51:43.4100 AuthoredAt is 3/31/2006 10:49:58 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:43.4100 Content is Implemention Notes 

Read-Only Layers: By default Joe only has access to a layer in a read-only mode. The list of layers Joe can see is still governed by the Work Pools list in their access group. In order for Joe to have the ability to modify a layer they need to have a Skill set in their Data-Admin-Operator-ID. In order to set this up, do the following:1.Add a Rule-Admin-Skill rule with the name Modify-[workpool name]. (e.g. Modify-DevUSMort-Service-Eval-Small). The skill range is not used so just set it at 1 and 1. Make sure the ruleset for the skill is in synch with the ruleset for rules going into that class so everything will move together correctly.Update the Data-Admin-Operator-Id record for your Joe. Go to the Work Access tab and add the skill.The changes to Joe will only take effect after his next login.
2014-12-20 16:51:43.4180 Author is Admin

2014-12-20 16:51:47.2170 AuthoredAt is 3/31/2006 11:12:04 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:47.3120 Content is Implementation Notes 

No children classes on explorers: The explorer trees will no longer show children classes. If you bring up DevUSMort-Service-Eval you will NOT see the -Big, -Medium or -Small classes in the tree. This, along with the peer nodes being displayed, will probably take some getting used to.
2014-12-20 16:51:47.3150 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:51:48.7740 AuthoredAt is 3/31/2006 11:13:32 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:50.3050 Content is Implementation Notes 

Exceptions only at leaf nodes: The current vision for the implementation of decision layers requires that Exceptions only be allowed at the "leaf" nodes.In order forthe "Exceptions" to display in theleftside navigation frame you need to add a config setting.Add a Rule-DSE-ConfigData record with theClass Name the name of thelayer and the Configuration Nameas "ExceptionsValid". In the record the Config Name should be "ExceptionsValid" (as an aside...why is this repeated?) and the Config Value as "true". See TomsCandyRetail-Service-PurchaseCandy.ExceptionsValid as an example. Once this is done you should be able to change the layer and see Exceptions in the left frame.
2014-12-20 16:51:50.3050 Author is Admin

2014-12-20 16:51:50.6660 AuthoredAt is 3/31/2006 11:14:02 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:50.6700 Content is Implementation Notes 

Exceptions only at leaf nodes: The current vision for the implementation of decision layers requires that Exceptions only be allowed at the "leaf" nodes.In order forthe "Exceptions" to display in theleftside navigation frame you need to add a config setting.Add a Rule-DSE-ConfigData record with theClass Name the name of thelayer and the Configuration Nameas "ExceptionsValid". In the record the Config Name should be "ExceptionsValid" (as an aside...why is this repeated?) and the Config Value as "true". See TomsCandyRetail-Service-PurchaseCandy.ExceptionsValid as an example. Once this is done you should be able to change the layer and see Exceptions in the left frame.
2014-12-20 16:51:50.6700 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:51:50.8290 AuthoredAt is 3/31/2006 11:16:45 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:50.8610 Content is Implementation Note 


Peer nodes on explorers: RMF will now display the "peer layers" on the rules explorer subject to the following rules: 1) A peer is determined by Named, not directed inheritance. The system will take the current layer, get it's named parent and then get that classes children. 2) The list of "peers" will be filtered by those you have access to review. For example, DevUSMort-Service-Eval-Big has a named parent of DevUSMort-Service-Eval. The parents children are -Big, -Medium and -Small. If your current list of valid layers does not contain -Medium then you will not see it in the rules explorer tree. 3) The currently selected layer is always listed as the first node in the tree.
2014-12-20 16:51:50.8610 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:51:51.0320 AuthoredAt is 3/31/2006 11:17:13 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:51.0470 Content is Implementaion Notes 

Peer nodes on explorers: RMF will now display the "peer layers" on the rules explorer subject to the following rules: 1) A peer is determined by Named, not directed inheritance. The system will take the current layer, get it's named parent and then get that classes children. 2) The list of "peers" will be filtered by those you have access to review. For example, DevUSMort-Service-Eval-Big has a named parent of DevUSMort-Service-Eval. The parents children are -Big, -Medium and -Small. If your current list of valid layers does not contain -Medium then you will not see it in the rules explorer tree. 3) The currently selected layer is always listed as the first node in the tree.

2014-12-20 16:51:59.4970 AuthoredAt is 4/5/2006 5:43:45 PM
2014-12-20 16:51:59.5010 Content is Meeting Results and Direction 

we talked about storing each value from the MOP history in a value list, and Mike R. suggested a page list, since there will probably be data accompanying the actual value. Mike was concerned about performance, Greg Parks is just concerned about complexity, and with further thought, we realized that maybe we don't need to store the whole array.

A possible direction, which seems likely now, is that some operation parse the MOP history once and store the resulting (summarized) data in a format the kim can use without further recourse to the history itself.

For example (and this is a simple one, but illustrative): the MOP history "1111133211111 "
(note that spaces represent "unknown")
we would storesomething likethis:
* Current, 1 month ago,5 months running
* 60 days late,6 months ago,2 consecutive months
* 30 days late,8 months ago, 1 month
* Current, 9 months ago, 5 consecutive months
* Unknown, 14 months ago, 3 months running...

then other summarization could happen from there
we could provide kim with the following (we need to determine the complete list of data that is interesting)
number of 30 days lates (per tradeline and total per credit report and overall sum)
number of 60, 90, 120, lates etc.
number of <N> lates in the last two years
number of mortgage lates (last 2yrs and total)
most recent/months since any late(s)
months since repossesion, foreclosure
same info for collection or charge-off
...

2014-12-20 16:52:35.5870 AuthoredAt is 5/18/2010 3:41:35 PM
2014-12-20 16:52:35.5870 Content is Story 6015 & 6044 Business Requirements / Questions 

Following are the additionalbusiness requirements / questions that were triggered as a result of the approach for Profile Management being moved to the business:
Business Response to recommendation story 6044:

1.We want to control the access for the functionality to a very limited group based upon something similar to how the ARWeb system is managed, which currently has two administrators per site.SAM would have to adhere to these types of restrictions for additions and deletions.

User edits could be made available for a broader group but it still must be limited to someone such as the Administrator role at each site.
1.Will this require a new role?Administrator or Super Administrator accesses as they exist today may have limitations.E.g. MI SA does not have skills
2.No matter the solution offered the management surrounding granting permissions to this role will be limited to SAM_Team and/or Sustain with approval from representation from the SAM_Team
3.Vendor access may not be available to be managed by a site representative (e.g. VanWagenon cannot make updates in our system due to limitations established by IT standards and security standards.)
4.Exchange currently contains GMAC sponsorship for any vendor.We may want to mirror that type of activity in SAM.
5.Currently SAM Profile management is based upon WorkGroups that are similar to Site Management.EGRoseville,DallasHRC, VanWagenon, Sitel, etc.Based upon this, there may be a need in this process for SAM were some of the authorizers may require access across sites, while others may be limited to a specific site.E.g. EO authorizers for allUSsites, whileRosevillewould be limited toRosevilleaccesses.Can this type of management be made available?
2.Identify what profile changes will be managed by sustain versus the business.E.g. Will mass and/or release updates continue to be managed by the sustain team?
3.Step by step instructions will be necessary including screen shots before this story can be signed off and or testing conducted or a very enhanced solution document containing all of the information may be acceptable.Following are some of the areas that the direction should include:
1.Requirement to add: Users should not be able to add or update a user with an invalid Unit/Workgroup/Role combination for all, not just Account Servicing
2.Requirement to add: Provide helpful messaging (when trying to set up an invalid combination, when trying to delete a user with items in their work list, when trying to add a user who does not have a valid/current Exchange ID, etc).
3.Requirements for deletions:Identify any limitations / updates that must be made to delete a profile.
e.g. Work list has open items listed.
4.Requirements for Edits  will there be limitations to the edits?Will there be required fields?If there is a sponsor for Vendors, etc requirements how will we identify who the sponsor is?
5.What about assigning skills and workbasket access that we are not able to do in Account Servicing without creating a ticket? This is not addressed below but if we are going to build a portal for adds/deletes/updates maybe it should also be included in the add and update section
4.Current technical challenges that we have observed regarding profile management as it exits today:
1.There were some technical challenges in MI with creating messages to identify that items exist in a users work list if anyone tried to delete the ID. This was raised before we deployed last year as a potential issue considering work items disappear into black hole if user id deleted.
2.Work list has open items listed.
3.Currently there are no notifications or reports in place for workbasket or worklists to ensure that business functionality is not impacted should a user be remove
2014-12-20 16:52:35.6240 Author is Member:15541

and

2014-12-20 16:54:22.2060 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:54:23.0920 AuthoredAt is 5/2/2006 2:29:58 PM
2014-12-20 16:54:25.2350 Content is Original story text 

Below is the original story test which I am copying here for completeness. The actual work is described in the Unit test and the revised story text.

********************************************************************************************
Currently, excecute rules by category will find all of the rules in the specified category along with rules tagged with any sub category. This has worked well for simple decisions, but Tom the product manager will need more flexibility in how rules are executed. This is of value to Tom because more complicated decisions may be handled by the system.

Need the documentation from the meeting on 3/24 where this was discussed. Did Terry writeup these notes?

Some topics for discussion:
When rules for a topic need to run in a specific order, is it appropriate to create sub categories and sub sub categories strictly to support runtime ordering?
Or
Do we have a custom flow in each Program to support the reordering of categories at runtime?
Or
Do we have a rule in the Program that calls the rules it needs from within when order is important?
Also, the properties that each Program uses to make Grading decisions is different and therefore may drive out more subcategories that or only appropriate for that specific program. That would drive a need to have a custom flow for each program to support the calling of program specific categories.
Also, if we create sub categories and sub sub categories, do we want to change RMF to support Run Rules By Category controlling whether to run only the rules in the category specified or run all rules in the child categories also and in what order??
Jeff
2014-12-20 16:54:25.2500 Author is Admin

Created TestCreditCalculationsMW to modify data for additional scenarios.Borrower 1: Tradeline 2nd-Year MOP120Plus values are: 2, 4.For borrower 1, I expected 6but got 9.Borrower 2: Tradeline 2nd-Year MOP120Plus values are: 4, 0, 0. Expected 4 and got 4. However, when I changed the value of the 3rd tradeline, I got an incorrect value returned.Notes:MOP30, MOP60, and MOP90 values all passed.

2014-12-20 16:54:32.6700 AuthoredAt is 5/8/2006 4:48:28 PM
2014-12-20 16:54:32.6920 Content is Issues around NoOp rules. 

After researching the details of the system we have discovered that we have a number of issues regarding "NoOp" rules that must be, at least initially, resolved by the underlying PRPC code.

As a result, we will add a story totemporarily remove the ability for the system to create a NoOp rule. Also, a new story will be added to get a bug described and entered into pega support. . We will move this story tothe Future when we canonce again enable NoOp processing.

2014-12-20 16:54:35.9330 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:54:36.0930 AuthoredAt is 5/8/2006 5:10:33 PM
2014-12-20 16:54:36.1080 Content is During a conf call with TSteinle on 5/5/06 

is was decided that:

1) We will not use the "call(xxx)" notation as described in the story description.
2) We will enhance the system to prevent have the initial Decision Tree set to not allow the calling of other trees/tables or maps via the "build in" dropdowns on the tree rule form.
3) We will support the notation of calling "like rules" (i.e. trees calling trees, maps calling maps and tables calling tables) using the return value of "Call NameOfRule".
4) We write a message to the team informing them of this direction and discourage them from changing the tree settings to allow them to reenable the dropdowns.
2014-12-20 16:54:36.1080 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:54:36.2700 AuthoredAt is 5/8/2006 5:15:04 PM
2014-12-20 16:54:36.2700 Content is During a conf call on 5/5/06 with TSteinle 

we decided the following:

1) We do not want expressions calling tables, trees or maps because a) You cannot get an "exceptioned" version of them and b) you cannot control how many times they will fire (and in turn emit messages).
2) We will write an email informing them the team of this.

2014-12-20 16:54:47.8830 Content is Epic - Requirements Missed in the detailed letters 

The following requirements are necessary to properly complete the Registartion Power of Attorney:
1) If the fulfillment option of Fax is selected couple the document with the new fax cover letter.
2) If the fulfillment option for any other selection is made, the generic cover letter (from SAM Bankruptcy) will be coupled with this document. The default statement on the document will be:the last example that just states please see the enclosed.
3) Please leverage the requirements from this updated EPIC story over the detailed stories to ensure that the requriements are not missed.

2014-12-20 16:54:58.1230 AuthoredAt is 1/4/2011 9:46:25 PM
2014-12-20 16:54:58.1350 Content is Technical Team Questions 2011 01 04 

Should display Address Info and Vehicle description?
20110104:lsz - should what display the address information and the vehicle description?
The cover letter or the Power of Attorney?Yes the cover letter would follow the reference formatting requirements for a cover letter, which includes the Account Number, Customer Name, VIN and Year, Make and Model
The Power of Attorney?No, the power of attorney form would not apply the reference formatting requirements that includes the account number, customer name, VIN and year, make and model.The values that exist on the letter would be populated.

Should we follow the standard font face and size (Arial, 10pt)?Yes.See the updated sample to be used as a guide

Does this document requires a cover letter?Yes, if the document is sent through the print vendor.If local print, the cover letter could be optional based upon user selection.I believe I called this out in one of the stories containing the updates for this document.

In the Title Owner Section, an additional requirement of Tax IDs is mentioned in the story but missing in sample, please provide the sample includes Tax details.Story Description:
In addition to that, there will be a place holder for 3 tax ids- manual entry(these will appear on the letter only when values are entered(dynamic rows)):
The labeldescription and the value will be added:
Label 1 Value1
Label 2 Value2
Label 3 Value3
Sample attached.The requirement will be that the fields are available on the wireframe and if populated will be displayed on the letter.

Story 6321  Questions from Technical Team
lsz 2011 01 04 Responses
1.Should the template follow the standard font face and size (Arial, 10pt)?
Yes, the document as provided in the sample will apply the Arial 10 pt font requirements.
2.Should the template follow the samples attached in the story for both English and Spanish?
Provided an updated version of the Spanish letter.Please use the English sample provided.
3.Should we follow consistent rules to align the label and the values available in the samples?
Yes
4.Company in the Cover Letter sample is hardcoded as Ally Servicing, Should we map it to company long name?
Yes, please use the brand information, but if the user selects the document from the no account menu, the user will need to select the brand that will be reflected in the disclosure statement.If they do not select anything, the default will be Ally  just like the BIN requirements outline

2014-12-20 16:55:02.1190 AuthoredAt is 1/7/2011 10:39:54 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:02.1310 Content is Cannot reproduce consistently  (Comment)

Screen utilizes significant client AJAX functionality to show/hide fields and perform data validation in response to user input.
My hypothesis isthese AJAX calls to the server are occuring either in an inconsistent order, or some are not completely properly, such that the browser state and/or clipboard state are inconsistent, and result in this error.
One possible solutionis to simplifythis screen by reducing the onchange data validation, which would in turn reduce the AJAX calls, and minimize the opportunity for this type of problem.

this issue is really two defects:
1. the date validation rules, which have been corrected via a patch was installed in Dev, and still need to be installed to SIT (the problem still occurs in SIT)
2. when a date fails validation, the date format should not be changed to the internal Pega Date format (20110111T000000.000)
I corrected this second issue by changingthe standard Pega DateTime HTML Property rule in unlocked Pega-ProCom:05-05-16. Terry is discussing with Mark and other on how best to handle this.

The To is equal to the Name

Fax Number will appear as required
Phone Number is not required
The page number will default to the cover + number of pages from the original document and default the comments section to the statement included with the Generic Cover Letter.Please see the enclosed.

Override: This is a signature block that overrides both the Personalized and Generic based upon the rules that are outlined in the story on a letter by letter basis.
Sincerely,
[Story Requirement Signature]
Phone: [Phone from Decision Table]
Fax: [Fax from Decision Table]
There is no need for the "CC"
2014-12-20 16:55:29.6940 Author is Member:15541
2014-12-20 16:55:29.8720 AuthoredAt is 3/7/2011 10:37:00 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:29.8720 Content is Business Review of Splash Page Recommendation Feedback / Questions 

Business Review of Splash Page Recommendation Feedback / Questions
a.Discussion regarding the Splash Page  A sample of the original splash page was displayed for the team.A request has been made tomove the different sections around, adding a Whats New section on the top right and moving the Messages section to the center of the page.
b.Following are the questions that will be posed to the Ally Pulse Team:
i.How quickly and who can put information in there?The updates are immediate if the current functionality is available for the Servicing AutoMation page.The who: Linda Zylstra has permissions to make updates, will need to research to determine if another business representative and a technical representative can be included to make updates to specific sections of the page.
ii.There will be a need to communicate to another population of the business that will not necessarily log into SAM.What communication means can be put into place to make SAM updates available for those that are not SAM users?
iii.The business team has a requirement to reduce the number of clicks it takes to access information, because the majority of the end users are timed or measured for thief output/ through put.The presentation as it stands will require the user to click on the SAM link on the Work Tools page and then select Launch SAM on the splash page.Is there a way that the SAM link can auto pop, while at the same time keeping open the interim splash page?
iv.If the splash page is kept open, how will immediate messaging function when updates are made that need to be broadcast across the population?
v.Does this work differently for users that are logged in versus those that are not?
vi.Will there be a means available to manage the Splash page updates based upon user permissions?There is a need to limit information to specific users such as:Vendors, Attorneys, where Ally Servicing Employees or contracted employees will receive more updates/links.

Based upon the initial review, the recommendation for the approach for communication appears that it could meet the business needs if the above requirements are met.
2014-12-20 16:55:29.8940 Author is Member:15541
2014-12-20 16:55:30.9000 AuthoredAt is 3/8/2011 1:30:01 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:33.0840 Content is Changing of the Registration State 

During a conversation regarding the Registration State selection available on the wireframe, there was a concern raised that if the user changes the registration state they will also be changing the "Owner" or "Lienholder" updates even if they over rode the information in the read/write fields.

To address this concern the business request is to have a sentence included on the wireframe whichindicates to the end user that by changing theRegistrationState, they will be changing the Owner and Lienholder to align with the state selected.

The sentence can be"Changing theRegistrationStatealso changes the Owner and Lienholder information as it aligns to theRegistrationState. Please review all of the fields to reflect titling updates."

lsz email 03/31/2011
Team,
I spoke to Kathy regarding the requirement about Ally Capital versus Ally Bank versus Ally Bank Corp and determined that there was a misunderstanding of the information that was provided.

The US Registration POA will have reference to Ally Capital for branding based upon the mailing states (HI, MS, MT, NJ, WI), but the lien holder in those states will always be Ally Financial.Based upon this conversation, I believe that if we add a question to the story to provide the State  pull the state into the wireframe for Registration and Mailing based upon the answer made for the Registration POA, then everything will be updated properly.

Ive updated the story with this information and added a new worksheet that includes the State reference.

Based upon this new information, do you want another meeting for clarification of story 6988 or the Registration POA?

Hello Howie,

Thank you for the approval.

Yes, the new placement will not have an impact for US and Canada Mail Imaging,for Canada MI (Contact Packages) the Comments and Attachment sections by default expanded and this push the Image field Section to the end and User need to scroll down to view the image.

The View Full Screen option will open the PDF image in Full Screen

2014-12-20 16:55:37.0870 AuthoredAt is 5/31/2006 4:28:33 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:37.1060 Content is Algorithm 


LienAmount = 0
FOR each public record
IF(.Class = Lien) AND
(.Satisfied = False) AND
(.DateSatisfied= 0)
THEN
LienAmount= LienAmount + .ActionAmount
END IF
END FOR
2014-12-20 16:55:37.1060 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:55:37.2700 AuthoredAt is 6/1/2006 9:25:16 AM
2014-12-20 16:55:37.2920 Content is Business Algorithm 

Set to satisfied for;
Atax lien with a status of released, satisfied, paid, cancelled, judgement for defendant

OR a bankruptcy with a status of discharged, voluntarily discharged, involuntarily discharged, settled, released, completed, dismissed

OR a judgement with a status of discharged, voluntarily discharged, involuntarily discharged, settled, released, satisfied, dismissed, vacated, discharged in bankruptcy, judgement for defendant, paid, cancelled

This doesn't apply to foreclosures

2014-12-20 16:55:37.4630 Content is Algorithm 

NumberOpen2Years = 0
FOR each tradeline
IF (.CreditReportDate - .DateOpened >= 24 months) THEN
NumberOpen2Years =NumberOpen2Years + 1
END IF
END FOR

CreditSummary.Tradeline.NumberOpen2Years =NumberOpen2Years
2014-12-20 16:55:37.4630 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:55:38.5110 AuthoredAt is 6/1/2006 10:00:02 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:40.2420 Content is Algorithm 

ChargeOffAmount = 0
FOR each tradeline
IF (.ChargeOffIndicator = True) AND
 (.DerogatoryIndicator = True) AND
 (.IncludedInBankruptcy = False)
THEN
ChargeOffAmount= ChargeOffAmount+ .ActionAmount
END IF
END FOR

CreditSummary.Derogatory.ChargeOffAmount= ChargeOffAmount
2014-12-20 16:55:40.2420 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:55:40.4170 AuthoredAt is 8/11/2011 5:28:26 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:40.4400 Content is Further follow up points 

For the CARS / GIF Integration Efficiency discussion, here are some items that we have discussed:
1) ASET project will be making use of the GIF transactions as is. There are no plans to change those at this time.
2) Performancetalks include the following:
a)Look at options around improving GIF tohandle sending multiple requests in one packet, have the GIF iterate to collect all the data, and provide back one response. This is currently not available in GIF and will be discussed as part of the 2012 portfolio talks.
b) Parallel processing within Pega - This is probably not an option for us as the effort to do this would be somewhatsignificant. In addition, GIF has synchronization on the MSMQ queue's sothe effort we make on our sidewould probablybe bottlenecked at the GIF side.
c) Excel spreadsheet import -Since SAM relies on making calls to CARS, it seems that uploading a spreadsheet with CARS data in it doesn't quite make sense. This may introduce additional management of data and synchronization.
d) For DocGen 2011.04, the performance items we would look at include: improvements in the process for multiple documents, any improvements in performance related to GIF server updates/patching, D2D infrastructure migration, as well as performance gains around the Adobe upgrade.

2014-12-20 16:55:45.2620 Content is Clarification regarding the requirement for importing external information into SAM either from Excel or text files ("c" above):
1)  The objective for this import as it relates to the CARS information would be limited to the account number or VIN.  The actions required are not to replace the existing integration with CARS.  It is to address the existing limitations to the CARS initgration.
2)  The additional information that is needed to support the document, which may not be available from the current CARS transactions would be included in the external import.  e.g.  Tax information, the incorrect number included with the payment, U Drive If fees.  These are different examples of information that is not available in CARS but will be needed for the document generation process, where if an import is available, would eliminate manual updates on a letter by letter basis.

With this clarification

2014-12-20 16:55:45.6170 AuthoredAt is 6/2/2006 9:14:09 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:45.6230 Content is Blocking a rule from an exception 

Mike,

I built a quick test and I don't believe this ever worked. The list of rules in an exception is built in Rule-DSE-Exception.LookupRulesByException which was built in Oct and last edited in Nov by Mark. It appears to have always called "resolve list" on the exceptioned rules, which would have tossed the blocked exception rule before we ever got to the ExecuteRulesByCategory step.

In fact, the comments in the activity indicate that this was the desire - "The consequence of calling resolveList is that any rule that is blocked in an exception will not be found, therefore the base rule will be executed."

Mark - Do you recall why we wanted to resolveList at this point? I am not sure of the reason behind this. Incidentally, this would also prevent rules that are added directly into the exception from firing (since as far as I can tell resolveList knows nothing about exceptions). This would be true regardless of the availability of the NoOp. (I believe that we have other places we would "toss" these as well, so this would not fix that particular issue completely.)

I can try to check out the activity and comment out the resolve list and see what shakes out, but I wanted to run it by you guys first to see if you remember a reason for it.

Regards,
Greg Erickson
Pegasystems Inc.

Build for Change(tm)
________________________________

Greg,

At yesterday's standup someone mentioned that blocking a rule from an exception no longer works. This doesn't make sense to me. Do you have an idea about this problem, or should I follow up the team for more details?

2014-12-20 16:55:45.6230 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:55:45.8050 AuthoredAt is 10/10/2011 6:01:06 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:45.8270 Content is This is to clarify the requirement surrounding ECF eligibility of the addressees in the Switchplate (Obligated parties, filing parties, clerk, trustee, filing parties attorney, Pro-se Attorney). It is presently unclear in the story that not all of the recipients need to have the ECF eligibility requirement (toggle of the Electronically Filed and the Physical Address on the POC.)  The only parties that need to receive the ECF requirement are the Trustee and the Filing Party Attorney. If the ECF eligibility check Yes/No Indicator is check yes then the /s/ signature is used and the Trustee and Filing Party Attorney will have the Served Electronically without the physical address.  The inverse is true if no is selected. 

The clerk of court will not have the ECF logic for the text to appear or not beneath the addresses. Also, the pro-se attorney, filing parties, and obligated parties will not have the option for served electronically to appear. 

The decision was made to have a single check yes/no ECF indicator for all ECF eligible recipients (Trustee, Filing Party Attorney).

2014-12-20 16:55:53.3200 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:55:53.5080 AuthoredAt is 6/12/2006 4:49:34 PM
2014-12-20 16:55:53.5330 Content is These are accomplished by setting the 

custom field "DoubleIterationStyle". The values that correspont with the test options are:

1. Full (default) - (i = 1; i < N ; i++)(j=1; j< M; j++)
2. SkipDups - (i = 1; i < N ; i++)(j=1; j< M; j++){if (i == j) continue;}
3. Unique -(i = 1; i < N ; i++)(j=i+1; j< M; j++)

These can be tested using the Double Iteration - [style] tests in theBliss QA 1 / Channel 1 layer.

2014-12-20 16:56:01.4450 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:01.7260 AuthoredAt is 6/13/2006 4:17:23 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:01.7760 Content is *** Original Story Text *** 

When Joe clicks on the Domain in either the Rules or Exceptions tab the system will build the entire tree. This can take many seconds depending on the size of the domain. The benefit of the current solution is that once it is complete the entire tree is instantly available to Joe. The drawback is that it takes a long time (longer for each node added to the tree) and a lot of system/db resources.

Since Joe will probably only be working on a small number of nodes at a time we should reconfigure the tree GUI to use AJAX (same technology as the refresh button)to only build the node details when the user clicks on it. We can decide to do this either for each child node or only at the "root node" level (i.e. once Joe clicks the root node all of its children are built).
2014-12-20 16:56:01.7930 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:02.3370 AuthoredAt is 6/13/2006 4:19:22 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:05.0460 Content is Story changed - Ajax work moved 

The details of this story changed from the original content. Originally it was to implement AJAX and defer the loading of the nodes until user clicks on one. This text has moved to story S-01908 and placed into the backlog.

This story now represents some GUI changes that were necessary to make the Domain Explorer more usable for Joe.

2014-12-20 16:56:05.4160 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:05.5800 AuthoredAt is 6/13/2006 9:13:03 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:05.5940 Content is Not a bug. 

Discovered that Joe really can not be allowed to change the category of a rule after the first rule set version containing the initial rule is locked and promoted to production. If we allowed Joe to change the category we'd always run into the problem where runRulesByCategory would blindly pickup and execute the rule twice; once with the old category and a second time with the new category. Given this situation we've decided that Joe can not change a rule's category. Need to disable the editing of custom rules so that Joe can not change a rule's category.
There is a situation where Joe could change a rule's category. That's when the rule is initially created and is only in an open ruleset version. In this case, it would be Ok for Joe to change the rule's category. If needed, these capability will be written up in a future story.
2014-12-20 16:56:05.5940 Author is Admin

Added section to MPB Fundamentals document on the reasoning why we will prevent Joe from modifiying the category.

2014-12-20 16:56:10.6460 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:10.8150 AuthoredAt is 6/14/2006 4:45:28 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:10.8360 Content is Sent this email on 6/14 to mregan; tkrolak 

This story reads:As Joe the business rules manager, I need a way to see that a rule is nested and not invoked as a top-level rule. This is of value to me because I will break complicated business logic into chains of rules and will have to know which rules are top-level rules verse called rules.
We do not have any way today to look at a rule and tell if itis "called". The way the platforms are handling this today is by placing these called rules into a catagory that is never called by the flow. Joe has no way of knowing from just looking at the system (unless it's hinted at in the name of the category) that these rules will only run if/when referenced in another category.The only way I can think of being able to do this would be flagging each rule that is "called" with a custom field called something like "CalledOnly" and a value of "True". At runtime we are alreadying opening up each rule to check for a pagecontext to see if we need to perform double iteration, so it would not be any more expensive to check for a new custom field. If true, we would skip the execution of this rule. Otherwise continue as normal.If we decide to do this, I would like some opinion on how/where the list should by updated. Do we really want another column to take up space on the explorers for a column that will likely be No 95% of the time? Should we overload "Ready To Execute" to be "Yes (Called)", "No (Called)" or "Blocked (Called)"?If we do decide to go down this path I believe we are talking aprox 2-3 units to make the changes and test/document.Greg
2014-12-20 16:56:10.8360 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:11.0220 AuthoredAt is 6/14/2006 7:27:59 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:11.0400 Content is Original story text 

As a member of the Purple Horde responsible for building out implmentations, I need a mechanism to control the display order of sub-nodes displayed by an Explorer. This is of value to me because I need to specify display order of the sub-nodes in a way that makes sense to Joe the rules manager.

Double Iteration
Full
SkipDups
Unique

However, we used weights to make the order:
Double Iteration
Unique
Full
SkipDups

Further, up in Bliss QA1 / Chnl 1 we again overrode the order:
Double Iteration
Unique
Full
SkipDups

2014-12-20 16:56:38.3340 Content is Tradeline criteria 

Compare each tradeline to other tradelines (only if they are not already marked as duplicate).

IF(TR.BankruptcyIncluded = true) OR (TR.ActionAmount > 0)
IF (TR.AccountTypeMATCHES) MatchTradelineCriteriaCnt ++
IF (TR.HighBalanceAmount withinTHRESHOLD) MatchTradelineCriteriaCnt ++
IF (TR.DateOpenedMATCHES) MatchTradelineCriteriaCnt ++
IF (TR.AccountType <> Mortgage) AND (TR.CurrentBalance with $100) MatchTradelineCriteriaCnt ++

IF (MatchTradelineCriteriaCnt >= 3) then
Keep the tradeline with the higher TR.ActionAmount; mark the other as duplicate
If TR.ActionAmount is equal, then keep the tradeline that came first (sequential)


THRESHOLDamounts
IF either TR.HighBalanceAmount < 100
THRESHOLD = 10
ELSEIF either TR.HighBalanceAmount < 1000
THRESHOLD = 100
ELSE
THRESHOLD = 1000

2014-12-20 16:56:39.4120 Content is Public Record criteria 

IF (PR.Class = Judgment)
IF (PR.ActionAmount within $100) AND (PR.Ecoa MATCH) owner, right?
IF (PR.DateFiled OR PR.DateSatisfied) EXIST and MATCH
DuplicateFound = true
IF (PR.Class = Lien)
IF (PR.ActionAmount within $100) AND (PR.Type MATCH) AND (<dates match>)
DuplicateFound = true
IF (PR.Class = Foreclosure)
IF (PR.ActionAmount within $100) AND (<dates match exactly>)
DuplicateFound = true
IF (PR.Class = Bankruptcy)
IF (PR.Ecoa MATCH) AND (<dates match>)
DuplicateFound = true

IF DuplicateFound
IF (either PR.Satisfied = true) both PR.Satisfied are set to trueThe PR with the higher PR.DateSatisfied is marked as the duplicateIf PR.DateSatisfied MATCH then the PR with the greater PR.ActionAmount is marked as the duplicate



Dates Match
IF .DateFiled(1) exists AND .DateFiled(2) exists AND .DateFiled(1) the same as .DateFiled(2)IF .DateFiled(1) exists AND .DateSatisfied(2) exists AND .DateFiled(1) the same as .DateSatisfied(2)IF .DateSatisfied(1) exists AND .DateFiled(2) exists AND .DateSatisfied(1) the same as .DateFiled(2)IF . DateSatisfied (1) exists AND .DateSatisfied(2) exists AND . DateSatisfied (1) the same as .DateSatisfied(2)




the same as:
IF (PR.Class = Foreclosure)
Dates are an exact match
Else
Date are within 30 days of each other

PR.Ecoa = owner
