2014-12-20 16:56:41.8490 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:43.1710 AuthoredAt is 9/19/2006 2:36:11 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:44.6980 Content is How to test... 

Use the QA1/Chnl1 layer
Process Work Tab
Select --> Override Rule in an Exception
Set Fire Exception to "No" and Submit
You should see 6 messages(2 of each type). Note that each type has 1 at the BlissQAChnl1 layer and 1 at the BlissPlatMain layer. Also note that the message emitted in each case starts with "Test Msg". This is the baseline without the exception in play.

To test the override into the exception
Select --> Override Rule in an Exception
Set Fire Exception to "Yes" and Submit
You should again see 6 messages (still 2 of each type). However, the text of the message shoud be [rule name] @ IRFireException layer. These are rules overriden into the exception. Also note that the message text contains "(exception version)" which is text from a IRFireException version of the TestMsg message.

*** Note that the test says that these situations will create a "No Op" rule. As of PRPC 5.1 this is no longer necessary. As long as a version of the rule exists somewhere in the hierarchy then you can make a "circumstanced" version. We will still need NoOps under the covers for New Rules In An Exception, but thats a different test.
2014-12-20 16:56:44.7070 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:44.8700 AuthoredAt is 9/19/2006 2:54:22 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:44.8910 Content is How to test... 

Use the QA1/Chnl1 layer
Process Work Tab
Select -->New Rule in an Exception
Set Fire Exception to "No" and Submit
You should seeNO messages. This shows that no rules are firing without the exception in place.

To test the new rule in the exception
Select --> New Rule in an Exception
Set Fire Exception to "Yes" and Submit
You should again see3 messages.
The first message should be "Test Msg (exception version) - NewMapInException rule @ IRFireException layer - should only appear if exception in play". This tests that the rule will fire ONLY when the exception is in play...it adds a new rule to the category.

The second message should be "Test Msg (exception version) - NewMapInException3 rule @ IRFireException layer - testing new rule in multiple exceptions - this should display since it is rank 1". This was supposed to test the addition of a new rule with the same name into2 different exceptions. The system, however, does not allow the creation of the 2nd rule with the same name. I believe this is the "expected" functionality. If not, we should probably get a different story to enhance the system to allow it.

Note that we jump from NewMapInException to NewMapInException3. We have a NewMapInException2, however, it is set to Available = No. This tests that the rule can be turned off and we will not throw an error.

The final message is "EXCEPTION ONLY Message (msg added directly to the exception) - NewMapInException4 rule @ IRFireException layer - test emitting a message that only exists in an exception ". This tests that you can add a message directly into an exception and reference it in an exception only rule.
2014-12-20 16:56:44.9030 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:45.0710 AuthoredAt is 9/19/2006 3:11:11 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:45.0950 Content is How to test.... 

Use the QA1/Chnl1 layer
Process Work Tab
Select -->Block Rule in an Exception
Set Fire Exception to "No" and Submit
You should see6 messages. All of them should have the text "should be blocked if exception is firing".

To test the block rule in the exception
Select --> Block Rule in an Exception
Set Fire Exception to "Yes" and Submit
You should again seeNo messages.All the previous rules are blocked in the IRFireException exception and will prevent the rules from firing.
2014-12-20 16:56:45.0950 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:45.2600 AuthoredAt is 9/19/2006 3:17:42 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:45.2870 Content is How to test... 

Go to Rules and Exceptions --> Rules --> Messages
Note that under the category General Testing the message named "ExceptionOnlyMessage" is NOT in the list.

Go to Rules and Exceptions --> Exceptions and in the category IterativeRules select the IRFireException exception and place it in view or focus.

Go to Rules and Exceptions --> Rules --> Messages
See that under the category General Testing that "ExceptionOnlyMessage" now appears.

Running this message is tested in the Override rule in exception test above.
2014-12-20 16:56:45.2920 Author is Admin
2014-12-20 16:56:45.4560 AuthoredAt is 9/19/2006 8:57:48 PM
2014-12-20 16:56:45.4650 Content is How to test... 

Use the QA1/Chnl1 layer
Process Work Tab
Select --> Exception Not Available
Set Fire Exception to "No" and Submit
You should see1 message with the text "Test Msg - ExceptionNotAvailableMap1 @ ExceptionNotAvail2 level - should appear when IRFireException is Yes".

To test the Exception Not Available senario
Select --> Exception Not Available
Set Fire Exception to "Yes" and Submit
You should again see 1 message with the text "Test Msg (exception version) - ExceptionNotAvailableMap1 @ ExceptionNotAvail2 level - should appear when IRFireException is Yes ". The '@ ExceptionNotAvail2 level' is the key part here. We have a rule in ExceptionNotAvail1 and it is higher in the stack rank, but the exception is Draft/Not Available, so it falls through to the one in ExceptionNotAvail2.

2014-12-20 16:56:51.3970 Content is XML Test File for Profit Margin Not Found 

<REQUEST_GROUP>
 <SUBMITTING_PARTY />
 <REQUEST>
 <KEY _Name="PriceRequestType" _Value="WHSLF" />
 <REQUEST_DATA>
 <LOAN_APPLICATION MISMOVersionID="2.3.2">
 <ADDITIONAL_CASE_DATA>
 <MORTGAGE_SCORE _Value="660" />
 <TRANSMITTAL_DATA InvestorInstitutionIdentifier="2088" LenderBranchIdentifier="9999" RateLockType="BestEfforts" />
 </ADDITIONAL_CASE_DATA>
 <LOAN_PRODUCT_DATA>
 <ARM _ConversionOptionIndicator="N" />
 <LOAN_FEATURES LienPriorityType="FirstLien" PrepaymentPenaltyIndicator="N" PrepaymentPenaltyTermMonths="0" EscrowWaiverIndicator="Y" LenderSelfInsuredIndicator="Y" />
 <RATE_ADJUSTMENT />
 </LOAN_PRODUCT_DATA>

2014-12-20 16:56:57.0940 Content is Design 

The product access groups would utilize the quarterly applications but would then override the technical rulesets and new ones for development become available. The overriding would be accomplished by adding them one by one to the access group.
